Neighborhood Overview: The apartment is located right in the middle of Madrid's central district in what is known as Madrid's Soho ( MALASAÑA neighborhood ). One block away from the busy San Ildefonso square. This is without a doubt one of the trendiest, most exciting areas of this incredibly vibrant city. The area has innumerable shops, bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters, etc literally at your doorstep.  The building is a protected historical building from 1890, in a lovely small street boasting heaps of character! The space is very bright and sunny and even though it's centrally located it is very quiet and peaceful.
Transit: Very well connected with the airport, the Tribunal metro station is less than 5 minutes walk from the studio. The apartment's privileged central location will allow you to walk to most of Madrid's tourist attractions. However, if you want to use the metro, you have a variety of underground stations at minutes walk - Tribunal, Chueca, Bilbao and Gran Via stations are the closest.
Access: The studio has WiFi connection and a TV 32" with Netflix. It also has heating and air conditioning,  an iron, including clean towels ,sheets, bedding and pillows Fridge, a coffee maker with FREE coffee capsules, mineral water, decaf, different kinds of tea, fresh fruits, orange juice, milk, chocolate milk, cookies, croasants, apple tartlet, chips, olives and yogurt. ALL INCLUDED IN THE PRICE.  Also there is a complimentary free bottle red Wine Rioja Kettle with free tee bags, with fresh lemons,, a microwave oven, a bread toaster, crockery and cutlery, napkins, sugar and sweeteners. There is  a travel universal adaptor plug. The apartment is on the top fourth floor (without elevator), but the way up is nicely decorated with framed photographs that I shot myself. There's also a stylish cute wet-room with a head shower and a hair dryer (all together in one room). As you can see in the pics.
Interaction: I am a photographer and I previously used the space as my photographic studio. I have recently converted it to be used as a study/apartment, yet you will be able to sense how this wonderful space is definitely special! My own apartment, where I life, is next floor, so I am always available if there is anything you need or if you have any question.
House Rules: Non smoking. No pets.
Host About: Mi name is Al.  I have recently converted it to be used as a self catering apartment yet you will be able to sense how this wonderful space is definitely special! My own apartment, where I life, is in the same building, so I am always available if there is anything you need or if you have any question. I would be delighted to welcome tourists who want to discover  Madrid. His culture, museums, shopping, leisure, theater,  and gastronomy.

Summary: Encantador apartamento tipo loft de 100 metros cuadrados en pleno barrio de Salamanca junto al Retiro y a las puertas de la estación de metro de Retiro, línea 2. Lovely 100 sqm loft apartment of in the Salamanca district, very close to Retiro park.

El edificio en el que está situado el apartamento es nuevo, recién construido en un antiguo palacio con magníficas calidades y servicios. A building where the apartment is situated is recently renovated to high standards.

Neighborhood Overview: El barrio de Salamanca es el más emblemático de Madrid, repleto de buenos restaurantes, las mejores tiendas de la ciudad y cobija algunos de los mejores museos del mundo - Museo del Prado, Museo Reina Sofia, Museo Arqueológico Nacional y Museo Thyssen. La zona es ideal para disfrutar y conocer lo mejor de Madrid, pasear, comprar y degustar sus famosas tapas. ****************************************************************************** Salamanca is one of Madrid's historic neighborhoods in the core of the museum area. The Museo del Prado, Museo Reina Sofía, Museo Arqueológico and Museo Thyssen are 15 minutes far by foot. There are also great restaurants and shops in the area and Madrid's Golden Mile is two blocks away. The neighborhood and the apartment is especially recommended to those people who love promenading, visiting Madrid's best monuments and enjoying the city's famous tapas.
Transit: Situado a 2 min de la boca de la estación de metro de Retiro (linea 2, roja).  También a 10 min. paseando de la Plaza de La Cibeles y 5 min. de la Puerta de Alcalá.  Varias líneas de autobuses tanto diurnas como nocturnas así como una parada del autobus del aeropuerto permiten un rápido y cómodo acceso desde cualquier parte de la ciudad. ****************************************************************************** Entrance to the metro - RETIRO (line 2, red color) - is right at the door. 10 minutes far by walking from Plaza Cibeles, where round-the-clock airport bus stops. The bus ride takes 25 minutes and it is 5 euros.
Access: El acceso es de doble puerta con código de seguridad que da a un patio  muy luminoso que da acceso al ascensor, a las viviendas y al sótano en el que se encuentra la recogida de basuras. El edificio tiene acceso para ancianos, personas con dificultades de movilidad o necesitadas de ayuda. ****************************************************************************** The outside entry door of the building requires key/buzz-in and pass code to enter communal hallway that takes you to the elevator and the emergency exit staircase. A wheelchair platform lift is available to facilitate access from the building entry door to the elevator.
Interaction: Estaremos encantados de atenderles recomendándoles lugares de ocio o compras así como cualquier otra información para hacer  de su estancia en Madrid y en nuestra casa una visita inolvidable. Nos encanta Madrid y el Barrio de Salamanca. ****************************************************************************** We will be glad to host you in Spanish, English or German and recommend leisure options and places to visit within the city or in its whereabouts, to make your stay unforgettable.
House Rules: La entrada es de 14:00 horas hasta las 22:00. La salida debe ser anterior a las 12:00 horas, sin embargo esta hora puede ser flexible dependiendo de la ocupación del apartamento. El cambio de horario debe ser acordado y tiene un suplemento de 30 euros tanto si se modifica la entrada como la salida, este suplemento se pagará en metálico. No podrá realizarse la entrada o la salida entre las 22:00 horas y las 08:00. No están permitidos animal domésticos. No está permitido fumar en lugar alguno del apartamento incluido el balcón. No está permitido el alojamiento de mas personas que las acordadas en la reserva. Se ruega no realizar fiestas ni hacer ruido que puedan perturbar a los vecinos, especialmente después de las 23:00 horas. A la llegada te enseñaremos el apartamento y el funcionamiento de los electrodomésticos y cualquier otra información de su interés, así como la clave del wifi y del código de la puerta de entrada. Le entregaremos dos juegos de llaves. La pérdida de las llaves acar

Here you will find one of the most important shopping areas of the city with a Corte Inglés, Zara and all of the name brand stores. Centrally located and in a safe area, this apartment has the perfect location for both residents and visitors. Transit: It is calm, quite zone and you don’t have to spend so many time to get to some touristic, cultural or centric zone because it is so close to Plaza Mayor, streets like Cava Baja, Cava Alta, Arenal, Calle Mayor, etc… where you can enjoy of bars, shops. The easy access to our apartments, concretely this one, makes them an easy option to stay in Madrid for several days. 5 minutes walking is all you are going to spend to get to the very center of Madrid, so public transport is not going to be an option! There is public transport so close to the apartment. Bus, underground and taxi.

Interaction: We are doing the check in at the office, located at: Calle San Marcos, 9 28004, MADRID. There, we receive the customers, deliver the keys and explain the rules of the apartment. We also solve all kind of questions and doubts the customer could have at that point.
House Rules: Checkin is done at our office. The address: Calle San Marcos 9 28004 MADRID Our office hours are from 10.00 to 21.00. Late checkin (after 21.00 hours) is done in the apartment and has a surcharge of 30 euros. Guests arriving after office hours have to call ahead to inform about your arrival. No parties allowed at any part of the accommodation. Noises and volume must be controlled from 22:00 to 10:00 because all the accommodations are placed in normal neighborhoods so the rest of the people could be bothered. There are not more beds than the announced ones. The cribs are only available under petition. Smoking is not allowed. Pets are not allowed. We hope guests are polite and know how to behave. When checking out, please leave the keys on the table and take out the rubbish, if there is any generated on your stay, to the containers located out of the building.

Y una cosa muy importante para el verano, en esta casa no se pasa calor.

Somos Leticia y Fernando una pareja joven de Madrid que nos encanta el turismo y la gente. Somos una pareja viajera que nos disfrutamos muchísimo visitando cualquier rincón interesante del mundo y por supuesto... que nos visiten. 

Aquí en Madrid tenemos varios pisos en que hospedamos a amigos y conocidos de todo el mundo... y a todo aquel que quiera pasar algunos días en alguna de nuestras maravillosas casas, algunas realmente encantadoras. 

Nuestro único interés es que nuestros invitados se sientan como en casa y disfruten de su estancia en Madrid de la mejor forma posible.

Muchos amigos nos ayudan a conseguir este objetivo y comparten el sueño de ser anfitriones de nuestras casas.

Conocemos muy bien Madrid, porque es la ciudad donde nacimos y crecimos y si queréis saber cuales son las mejores experiencias de la ciudad nos encantará compartirla con vosotros.

Y de tanto viajar hablamos inglés y español para que podáis contarnos todas vuestras cosas.

¡Bienvenidos a Madrid!



We are Leticia and Nando a young couple from Madrid that love tourism and people. We are a traveling couple who love very much visiting any interesting corner of the world and of course ... that anyone visit us.

Here in Madrid we have several flats where our  friends share with us and of course people from all over the world ... anyone who wants to spend some days in one of our beautiful homes, could find some really lovely.

Our only interest is that our guests feel like home and enjoy their stay in Madrid in the best way possible.

Many friends help us achieve this goal and share the dream of hosting our homes.

We know Madrid very well, because it is the city where we were born and grew up and if you want to know what the best experiences of the city we will love to share them  with you.

We both speak English and Spanish so you can tell us  all what you need

Welcome to Madrid!

Neighborhood Overview: The Barrio de las Letras ows its name to the great writers who lived here during the artistic period calleed the Gold Century (17th century). Cervantes, Quevedo and Lope de Vega walked on these streets, between the Paseo del Prado and Santa Ana Square. This is one of the most popular areas in Madrid due to its charming pedestrian streets and it diversity of shops and restaurants, which make it particularly lively on the weekends. One of the favourite outings of regular visitors is a marketplace: El Mercado de las Ranas. On the first Saturday of every month, you can find the products out on the streets with special prices, and the shopkeepers decorate their shops, while street concerts and performances enliven the atmosphere. Within a few minutes walk you will find the main cultural activities in Madrid: Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofía Museums, where you can visit and admire the main art exhibitions in the world; the Botanic Garden; the Caixa Forum conference and exhibition center; the m

Neighborhood Overview: La Latina is one of the most famous neighbourhoods in Madrid, very central and near the most tourist areas of the capital. From the house you are walking distance to the Cathedral of The Almudena, The Royal palace, Sabatini's Gardens, The Plaza Mayor. The area is also very well known for being meeting point to enjoy the terraces, to have tapas, to have a few "cañas" and to visit the sunday Rastro market. La Latina was the old Arab quarter of Madrid, and the streets are narrow and closely cobbled. The whole area has a very bohemian and artistic air to it, making it a joy to explore.
Notes: Is hot this summer in Madrid!
Transit: It's a ten minute walk from Plaza Mayor, 14 minutes from Puerta del Sol. In regards to the metro, we are 2 minutes walk from the La Latina metro station (line 5), and 5 minutes walk from Tirso de Molina metro station (line 1). There are also plenty of supermarkets and dairys around.
Access: The breakfast is not included but you can always help yourself to coffee, tea that we have in the house with no problem. You can use the kitchen, the lounge, washing machine, etc. as if you were in your own home, always keeping the common areas clean and tidy. We have wifi so you are able to connect during your stay.
Interaction: We speak English, Spanish and Portuguese so I hope we can help you with any questions you might have! Due to the nature of our work and studies, normally someone is always at home for any questions. We enjoy a clean, friendly and respectable atmosphere in the house. We are more than happy to show you around the city, but completely respect your intimacy and understand if you have your own plans.
House Rules: We don't smoke, and as long as we all get to sleep before midnight everything is fine :)

Host About:
Home at Homes was created by two people: Karin Wallis, half English and half Swedish has lived most of her life in Madrid and Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano down to the marrow, has lived in Seville all of his life. We created Home at Homes as we wish to do something different: take peoples charming homes and transform them into rentals, keeping the magic and charm the owners created when they built their home but at the same time making it comfortable and adequate for our clients such as  giving them plenty of empty cupboard space,  ensuring the only food in the fridge is the one of our welcome hamper and making sure everything is working correctly and is sparkling clean so that when you arrive, the property will feel like instant home to you too. There are no two properties alike, nor are there two guest exactly alike but we do trust we will have the right home for you.

Neighborhood Overview: Es un barrio caracterizado por el trazado medieval de sus calles y la actividad a cualquier hora del día, rodeado de una importante oferta cultural, así como gastronómica y de ocio. Muy cerca también está el famoso teatro Valle-Inclán y a pocos pasos el famoso "Triangulo del arte", los tres famosos museos de Madrid: Reína Sofía, Museo del Padro y Museo Thyssen. Lavapiés es una barriada del centro de Madrid, dentro del más amplio barrio de Embajadores en el distrito Centro de la capital. Debido a su situación también es uno de los barrios con mas transporte público de la ciudad, encontrándose a pocos metros del apartamento la estación de metro de Lavapiés, Antón Martín o Sol.
Notes: Somos grandes conocedores y amantes de Madrid y, por ello, podréis esperar de nosotros cualquier consejo y recomendación al respecto desde el comienzo de su reserva hasta el final de su estancia. Estaremos encantados de ayudarle e informarle ya que nos enorgullece y nos hace feliz que la gente llegue a amar Madrid tanto como nosotros lo hacemos (monumentos turísticos, museos, bares, terrazas, discotecas, servicios próximos al apartamento...) En el mismo sentido, en el apartamento podrá encontrar una guía con indicaciones de la casa así como folletos con información útil acerca del transporte público y lugares madrileños turísticos. Por lo general, el check-in se deberá realizar desde las 15 pm en adelante. En caso de otra necesidad, no se preocupe, infórmenos y lo solucionamos. Si el mismo se precisa a partir de las 22 pm, habrá una tasa de check-in nocturno de 20€ a abonar en metálico en el mismo momento del check-in, incrementándose 10 € a partir de las 00:00 horas.
Transit: Metro closer: Antón Martín (line 1).
Access: El apartamento está preparado y equipado con todo lo necesario para que podáis disfrutar de cada uno de sus rincones. Se entrega con la ropa de cama y las toallas necesarias para los huéspedes. En el cuarto de baño, siguiendo las costumbres de los mejores hoteles, encontraréis jabón de manos, champú y gel de ducha. La vivienda esta completamente reformada en la que se ha cuidado hasta el último detalle. En este sentido, cuenta con todas las ventajas y comodidades de una casa moderna. Equipamiento: - Calefacción. - Wifi. - TV de pantalla plana. - Cocina completa (menaje, horno, microondas, placa de inducción, nevera, congelador, máquina de café, exprimidor manual. - Lavadora. - Calefacción. - Tendedero, plancha y tabla de planchar. - Telefonillo (portero inalámbrico). - Perchas en los armarios. - Se entrega con ropa de cama y 2 toallas para cada huésped además de alfombrilla de baño. Check-in-out a cualquier hora siempre que sea posible. Atención durante la estancia ante cualquier incid
Interaction: Check-in-out a cualquier hora. Atención durante la estancia ante cualquier incidencia que se pueda presentar. Somos grandes conocedores y amantes de Madrid y, por ello, podréis esperar de nosotros cualquier consejo y recomendación al respecto desde el comienzo de su reserva hasta el final de su estancia. Estaremos encantados de ayudarle e informarle ya que nos enorgullece y nos hace feliz que la gente llegue a amar Madrid tanto como nosotros lo hacemos (monumentos turísticos, museos, bares, terrazas, discotecas, servicios próximos al apartamento...) En el mismo sentido, en el apartamento podrá encontrar una guía con indicaciones de la casa así como folletos con información útil acerca del transporte público y lugares madrileños turísticos.
House Rules: - La hora de check-in es a partir de las 15 pm. - No se permiten fiestas ni reuniones de muchas personas en el apartamento. - No se permite ruído elevado, especialmente a partir de las 23h entre semana ó 24h los fines de semana. - No se admiten mascotas. - No se permite fumar. - Sacar la basura cuando sea necesario. Por favor, no la acumule en la vivienda durante la estancia (podrá retenerse depósito por no cumplir con este concepto). - Check-in, desde las 22 pm en adelante, conlleva un recargo de 20€ a abonar en efectivo en el mismo momento del check-in. ENGLISH: - No parties and gatherings of many people allowed in the apartment. - No loud noise, especially from 23h and 24h on weekends. - No pets allowed. - Smoking is not allowed. - Take out the trash when necessary. Please do not accumulate it in the apartment during the stay (deposit may be retained for this concept) - Checking in from 22 pm on carries a surcharge of 20 € to be paid on arrival in cash.
Host About:
Hola!!

Somos Abel & Emilio y estaremos encantados de estar a su disposición. Somos anfitriones y a la vez huéspedes, ya que una de nuestra principal afición es viajar. Conocemos bien ambos roles y, por tanto, sabemos muy bien lo que es alquilar nuestra propiedad a turistas y, del mismo modo, qué buscan los huéspedes de este tipo de alojamientos. Es decir, conocemos bien lo que se exige y lo que se espera de cada parte.
 
Desde el punto de vista del propietario, el alquiler de nuestra casa es siempre algo atractivo aunque no podemos dejar de olvidar el tiempo logístico e, incluso, dinero que ello conlleva. Es por ello por lo que hemos decidido ayudar también a otros anfitriones en la gestión de su vivienda turística.

Conocemos muy bien el mercado y, por ello, no tengan la menor duda de que BNBHolder os ofrecerá no sólo la posibilidad de alquilar sus casas sino también la posibilidad de brindar a todos nuestros huéspedes una memorable estancia gracias a la excelencia de nuestros servicios.
 
En BNBHolder no sólo nos encargamos del respectivo check-in-out sino que, también, los huéspedes serán asesorados por un equipo de profesionales- políglotas, grandes conocedores y enamorados de nuestra ciudad- para hacer de su estancia madrileña una experiencia única e inolvidable.

Danos su confianza y le daremos lo mejor de nosotros.

Equipo de BNBHolder.

Neighborhood Overview: El encanto del Madrid antiguo se encuentra en lo que los madrileños llaman "El Madrid de los Austrias". Este sobrenombre de esta parte del distrito centro madrileño tiene origen histórico: es en esta zona donde la dinastía de los Habsburgo creo los edificios históricos de una villa que ellos eligieron como capital de España. Sus edificios recuerdan la época imperial española, cuando los Habsburgo regentaban un imperio que iba desde más allá de los Paises Bajos hasta América. Los Austrias se extiende desde Sol recorriendo Mayor y Arenal hasta La Latina y la Plaza de Oriente. La manera de empezar el recorrido es andar los escasos metros que separan la Puerta del Sol de la Plaza Mayor. Esta Plaza es el corazón de los Austrias y tiene a un lado la Calle Mayor que lleva a Bailén y la Almudena - Plaza de Oriente - Palacio Real. Por el otro lado tenemos La Latina con su animación nocturna. foto de la plaza de la villa También desde la Puerta del Sol podemos cruzar la Calle Arenal que nos llev
Transit: El metro de Opera, está a un par de minutos del apartamento y el metro de Sol a 5, por lo que este apartamento está muy bien conectado a cualquier parte de la ciudad.

Space: The perfect place for visiting the city on foot, no bus, no taxies, no rush.  We have private and sharing rooms, exclusive for girls, families and group of friends.  All rooms have natural light, air-conditioned, most of them have private bathroom and balcony and latest WIFI technology.

Besides the 24 H concierge, The Hat Madrid offers Bike rental, free activities such as Tours or free Club´s tickets and special ambassadors to make the most of Madrid nightlife.  The palace has big common areas such as lobby, a special cave and one of the best top roof bars in the city. During the day you can enjoy the terrace as a solarium.  Apart from that, The Hat Madrid is the first Hotel in town using Biomass as energy source. Do you need anything else? Ask us, I am sure we can get it for you. Welcome  (URL HIDDEN)
Neighborhood Overview: The Hat Madrid est situé à la Calle Imperial nº9, à 50 mètres de la Plaza Mayor, entre la Puerta del Sol et La Latina. Dans le quartier vous trouverez d’innombrables restaurants, bars, clubs et commerces. Inutile de prendre le métro, le bus ou le taxi; tout est accessible à pied. A moins de 300 mètres vous trouverez 2 stations de métro, Sol et Tirso de Molina connectées aux lignes 1, 2, 3 et 5. Une vingtaine de lignes de bus passent tout près de l’hostel. Quelques exemples de distances à pieds : - Puerta del Sol  3 min. - La Latina 3 min. - Gran Vía 5 min. - Malasaña: 12 min. - Cibeles: 10 min. - Museo del Prado 15 min. - Museo Reina Sofía: 12 min. - Parque del Retiro 20 min.
Notes: Et plus encore… The Hat vous offre un grand nombre de services: surveillance 24h/24, location de vélo, visites guidées de la ville, entrées gratuites dans de nombreux clubs. Notre équipe internationale saura vous conseiller pour que vos soirées et vos nuits restent des moments inoubliables.

Host About:
Spain Select was born from the recognition of a desire among travelers to live locally in a real home whilst away from their own, and yet still enjoy all of the benefits and small luxuries of a hotel stay. Not only that, though, we understood that they also wanted to be close to all of the best that their destination has to offer – to be right in the heart of it all. So we decided to source a broad range of high quality homes in the most sought after locations across the country, starting with the capital Madrid and moving over to Malaga, Valencia, and Seville. We then added a few unique flourishes that embody our brand of service and our values. Our interior design team works to extract and enhance the natural charm from each space and make it a warm home. Our very own in-house Local Ambassadors are posted in each destination to welcome each guest home and bed them in to the neighborhood when they first arrive. Finally, a selection of hotel-like services – including a 24-hour concierge for everything from show tickets to new sheets – and a motorized maintenance team completes our comprehensive customer care throughout every single stay. Every Spain Select experience is unique, yet they are all of a consistent high quality no matter when you stay with us. 

Live local, sleep royal: welcome to Spain Select.

Summary: Comfortable, quiet and furnished apartment for 4-5 people (one double bedroom and one double sofa bed, and an extra sofa bed but only for special occasions, we prefer hosting 4 people, but if you are a family, ask me), at the historical Madrid center, with TV, WIFI, air conditioning, washing machine, and all the amenities you need for your perfect stay in Madrid! 5 min walking to Major square and 10 min to Paseo del Prado. We provide a little personal guide with our favorites places!
Space: PLEASE PAY ATTENTION AND READ CAREFULLY ALL THE DESCRIPTION (you have here all the information you need about the flat and our rules, and when you book you will receive an email from Airbnb with directions to arrive) The apartment is on the 5th floor of a nineteenth century building without elevator by now, at 100 meters from Puerta del Sol; unsurpassable location next to Plaza Santa Ana and Huertas street in the lively Las Letras neighborhood. You reach the main square (Mayor square) in just 5 minutes. Its location is perfect for walking around the most emblematic areas of Madrid : Barrio de las Letras, Sol , Plaza Mayor, Madrid de los Austrias and Gran Via is also an ideal place for you to walk to visit the Royal Palace and major museums enclave the Prado, Reina Sofia, etc. . You reach the main square (Mayor square) in just 5 minutes. It
Neighborhood Overview: Huertas neighborhood , also called for Literature , is one of the oldest and authentic Madrid , full of antique shops, beautiful vintage furniture shops , clothing or accessories ( like eg . Decodelia the store). It is also a neighborhood where you can enjoy the gastronomy of Madrid (and not only this , in Huertas is one of the best Italian restaurants in town , other Argentines, Indians, etc. . ) . There is a great nightlife , and the Plaza de Santa Ana is full of terraces and restaurants , and a theater. You also have a cinema in the original version very close to the house ( Cines Ideal ) . If you are interested in art , you will find around several art galleries (as La Fabrica ), the CaixaForum museum ( with its beautiful vertical garden ) , and close to Reina Sofia Museum and El Museo del Prado. A few minutes , you're walking to the Puerta del Sol , the city center , to the monumental Plaza Mayor, with the lively Mercado de san Miguel at his side ( highly recommended for tapas ) .
Notes: From airport the best way can be by bus till Atocha station and there you can take metro inside Atocha Station (2 stations to Tirso de Molina) or by taxi ( the flat is near, is not expensive, maybe 5€ if you take it out of the train station on the street, but it depends on traffic!). Or you can take metro inside airport directly, but you have to change trains 2 or 3 times (airport line goes to Nuevos Ministerios, and there you have to change to line 10 till Tribunal stop, and there take line 1 to Sol or Tirso de Molina, whatever). If you take a taxi from Airport is always 30€ to center. Fixed price. If you are abroad and have difficulty making a reservation in English, ask me for help!
Transit: The fastest public transport is the metro, the closest stops are those of Tirso de Molina or Sol Also in Jacinto Benavente Square in Atocha or Sol there are numerous bus stops and, of course, taxis. The Atocha train station is very close, a 20 minute walk. Anyway, everything is very close, you can go walking almost every interesting place in the Madrid's center.
Access: Of course you shall count bed linen, towels, soap and toilet paper for your stay.  To facilitate your stay in the kitchen  we provide some basics like salt, sugar, oil, vinegar, tea or coffee free.  We'll leave city and subway maps to guide you, and we are available for any problems that may arise or questions you have.  Our intent is to make your stay perfect!
Interaction: We will welcome you at the apartment to receive the keys and you can phone us for any questions or problems .  Check in time is after 12:00 am and check out at 11:00 am, although these times can be flexible if there's no another guest before or after; for different schedules please ask to us before. Check in after 21:00 is not a problem but has an extra payment of 10€ to pay when you arrive, and after 22:30 it would be 15€. After 23:45 the extra cost is 20€. For longer stays of more than 10 days we recommend to hire extra cleaning to ensure the maintenance of cleanliness in any case that the time is come speak . If not, we will ask you to commit yourself to leave the apartment clean, so we can deeply clean after in two hours as usual.
House Rules: We expect you to treat our home with care and respect as if it were yours. We ask you not to smoke in it.  We beg you, please do not leave trash when you leave the apartment. Containers are available down the road from 20.00 hours Recalls withdraw in any case before the end of your stay and leave the dishes and kitchen stuff clean (things that you used in the kitchen these days). The rest of the house we will take care, clean and change all clothing. Failure to follow these rules (if we found accumulated rubbish or very dirty house) could result in the failure to return the deposit. But we are confident that we forsake everything right!  Tell us your arrival time to the city and estimated time to the apartment for us to organize; the sooner you notify us to receive you will have fewer problems; if you are delayed, please let us know as soon as possible to avoid unnecessary delays. Check in after 21:00 has an extra payment of 10€, and after 22:30 15€, to pay when you arrive in cash.
Host About:
Nací en Valencia, estudié Biología y Educación Medioambiental entre los millones de cosas que me interesaban, y desde el 2004 vivo en Madrid, una ciudad que me encanta, siempre acogedora y generosa en todo lo que ofrece: su oferta cultural, sus animadas calles a cualquier hora, sus bares, sus cielos azules…. y por supuesto me encanta viajar, mezclarme con la gente de otros lugares y aprender. Viajar ayuda a entender muchas cosas!
Estoy encantada de poder recibir a viajeros que quieren descubrir esta ciudad, hacer de su estancia una experiencia lo mas agradable posible, poder resolver cualquier problema que les surja y aconsejarles lugares si lo necesitan! Es tan fácil como tratar a los demás como te gustaría que te tratasen a ti, no hay mas secretos. 
Bienvenidos pues!

Name: COSY APARTMENT IN LA LATINA
Summary: A fantastic two-bedroom apartment located right in the centre of Madrid in a popular area known as "La Latina", in the historic quarter of the city and within walking distance of landmarks like the Royal Palace, the Almudena Cathedral, the Royal Theatre (Opera House), the Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol.
Space: The apartment is on the third floor (no lift!!!) of a renovated 19th Century house. The apartment itself was also fully renovated and re-decorated recently. It has two bedrooms (currently only one bedroom is available), a living/dining room, kitchen and small shower room. It is an "interior" apartment, meaning that the windows do not overlook the street but rather an inner communal court or patio. This means that the apartment is very quiet at night as you do not hear the noise from the many nearby bars and pubs. The apartment is small but cosy. It is suitable for single travellers or couples. Blankets and bed linen are provided. No smoking is allowed in the apartment, and no pets, sorry.
Description: A fantastic two-bedroom apartment located right in the centre of Madrid in a popular area known as "La Latina", in the historic quarter of the city and within walking distance of landmarks like the Royal Palace, the Almudena Cathedral, the Royal Theatre (Opera House), the Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. The apartment is on the third floor (no lift!!!) of a renovated 19th Century house. The apartment itself was also fully renovated and re-decorated recently. It has two bedrooms (currently only one bedroom is available), a living/dining room, kitchen and small shower room. It is an "interior" apartment, meaning that the windows do not overlook the street but rather an inner communal court or patio. This means that the apartment is very quiet at night as you do not hear the noise from the many nearby bars and pubs. The apartment is small but cosy. It is suitable for single travellers or couples. Blankets and bed linen are provided. No smoking is allowed in the apartment, and no pets, sorr
Neighborhood Overview: a Latina is a cool and trendy area with a lively atmosphere and a bohemian-like feel. It is very pleasant in the day and you can just walk around the narrow cobbled streets and discover the history of the city, from ancient Arab times to the so-called “Madrid de los Austrias”, Madrid's Mediaeval quarter. It is also the place to go for tapas, especially on Sunday afternoon but the place is also bustling on Friday and Saturday night, when young Spaniards and foreigners alike fill the many pubs, restaurants and tapas bars.
Transit: La Latina metro (underground) station is just 2 minutes walk and buses also stop in the area, including the touristic double-decker buses. Plenty of taxis are also available but the truth is that, being so central, you can just walk to virtually anywhere in the centre of Madrid, from Gran Vía, Plaza de España and the Temple of Debod to Retiro Park, Cibeles and Casa de Campo.
Access: L
Interaction: I am available for my guests at any time on Airbnb's chat option and I always strive to answer to enquiries as soon as possible.
House Rules: - Respetar a los demás vecinos del inmueble y las normas de convivencia.
Host About:
I am a Spanish man based in Madrid. I was born and raised in Spain but I also lived in the UK for several years where I graduated in Linguistics at the University of Manchester. I work as a translator and interpreter and I also run a small translation business in Madrid. I love my job as it gives me the opportunity to do some of the things I like most: talking and communicating, meeting people and travelling around the world. 

I love languages: I am bilingual in Spanish and English and I can also speak French and Arabic. I am particularly interested in Arabic language and culture. I have been studying Arabic since 2007, mainly in Spain but also in Arab countries like Tunisia, Egypt and Jordan. I have also been to other countries in North Africa, the Middle East and the Gulf (Morocco, Jordan, Lebanon, Iraq, Kuwait and Qatar). 

Finally, I am educated, mature, approachable, respectful and easygoing, and I enjoy a good conversation over a coffee or a dinner party at home as much as going out and clubbing.
Street: La Latina, Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid 28005, Spain

It is a quiet place, surrounded by restaurants, bars and supermarkets.

Name: Apto a estrenar prox a Plaza Mayor
Summary: Apto a estrenar (enero 2015) junto a Plaza Mayor y emblemática Puerta del Sol. Moderno,acogedor y céntrico, hacen del apto un espacio único para disfrutar de una estancia tranquila, e imprescindible para conocer todos los lugares del Madrid antiguo.
Space: El apartamento está situado en la planta baja de un edificio antiguo recientemente rehabilitado. Dispone de 2 habitaciones, una con cama de 150 cm. y la otra con cama de 135 cm., salón con sofá-cama de 135 cm. Está totalmente equipado: wifi, televisión,  vitrocerámica, horno, microondas, frigorífico, lavadora, lavavajillas, menaje, cafetera, tostadora, exprimidor, secador de pelo, toallas y ropa de cama. Se accede a él a través de un callejón vigilado que separa 2 edificios palaciegos, sedes del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores. La decoración moderna y acogedora así como la ubicación, hacen del apartamento un espacio único para disfrutar de una estancia tranquila, e imprescindible para conocer todos los lugares históricos del Madrid antiguo.

Neighborhood Overview: Debido a su inmejorable ubicación, los huéspedes podrán disfrutar y vivir la ciudad aprovechando al máximo sus días de vacaciones.  Paseando podrán visitar los lugares más hermosos del centro de la ciudad: jardines, plazas, callejuelas del casco antiguo, etc., los cuales conviven con emblemáticos espacios culturales de la vida madrileña: museos, exposiciones, palacios, cines, música en vivo y teatros.  La oferta gastronómica y de ocio es rica y variada, pues comprende desde restaurantes, terrazas, bares y cocktelerías, a tiendas y centros comerciales, todo ello a un paso de casa.
Notes: Las estaciones de metro mas cercanas son Vodafone-Sol y Tirso de Molina
Transit: Los huéspedes podrán trasladarse desde la misma Puerta del Sol o desde la Plaza de Tirso de Molina a través de metro, tren, autobuses, alquiler de bicicletas y taxi a cualquier punto de la ciudad: aeropuerto, estaciones de tren, estaciones de autobuses, etc.
Interaction: Siempre que es posible nos gusta dar las llaves a nuestros huéspedes personalmente. La hora de entrada y salida del apartamento es flexible, y buscamos la mejor hora para los huéspedes que salen y los que entran.
House Rules: El piso está en un edificio muy tranquilo, por lo cual, pedimos a nuestros huéspedes que no hagan fiestas, que respeten las horas de sueño (a partir de las 23h.) y siesta y que el volumen de la música, televisión y conversación sea moderado. Tengan cuidado de apagar luces, calefacción y aire acondicionado al salir del apartamento. Es una casa muy tranquila debido a su ubicación dentro del edificio.

Soy una persona muy familiar y sencilla.

Intento compartir la mayor parte de mi tiempo con las personas a las que quiero, es mi mayor ambición.

Summary: We rent this silence and central design loft in one of the best neighborhoods to discover Madrid, the rest is guaranteed. Please read the house rules before placing a booking.

The apartment is in the ground floor of a building in one of the best neighborhoods of Madrid: Las Cortes. The apartment faces and internal patio, tranquility is guaranteed here! It has been decorated and prepared for you with all kind of details and high quality materials, trying to satisfy all your needs and make you feel at home from the very first moment. It has also a vintage deco desk perfect for those who are coming for work. This area includes and dining table bar for 4 people and the open plan kitchen, which is fully equipped with anything you need to cook and eat, including the stove, microwave,  and refrigerator.  * The double bed is upstairs and unde
Neighborhood Overview: Cortes is also known as the "Barrio de las Letras," or literary Madrid. This is where Spain's most celebrated Golden Age authors - Miguel de Cervantes, Lope de Vega, Calderón de la Barca, Tirso de Molina - lived in the 17th century. This is the best and nicest neighbourhood in central Madrid; you’ll immediately note how elegant it is from an architectural standpoint. The core of the “barrio” is Plaza de Santa Ana, and the streets radiating off this plaza are packed with bars -- good for tapas and experiencing the local life! On the first Saturday of the month, the “Frog Market” (Mercado de la Rana—named for the singing frogs that were in the area hundreds of years ago) takes place in the streets of Cortes; area retailers participate in this monthly market selling vintage clothes, furniture, and more. The neighbourhood is very lively, however the street where this apartment is located is semi-pedestrian: only residents and taxis are allowed to drive on this street. Therefore, it’s a qui
Notes: • Our check in time is from 4pm, meaning that by that time the apartment will be ready for use (although often ready before). However, if you come to Madrid earlier, we will make our best to allow you to let you luggage and we will give you the keys from 11:30am during week days (at no extra cost, it is simply a courtesy) or at the time when the cleaning lady is there on weekends (although we'll try to adjust her schedule to yours).  • In case you plan to arrive after 9pm, check in can be arranged by any of the following options:  1. A pick up from your arrival point (train station/airport/bus station) with the taxi driver we normally work with. He would pick you up and bring you to the apartment, leaving you settled and giving you a set of keys. The cost of this service is 10€ plus the regular taxi fare.  2.Reception in the apartment by us from 9pm to 11pm (subject to payment of 15 euro as late check in fee). Unfortunately after 11pm we are not able to meet you in person, so the taxi
Transit: The location of the apartment is perfect; you can visit everything in Madrid by foot or on our good public transport system. The main Madrid sites are well within a 15 minute walk and many are much closer: the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Bornemisza museums (5 minutes); the Retiro Park (8 minutes); the Gran Via and its neoclassic architecture (8 minutes); the Rastro market and La Latina neighbourhood, etc.  Antón Martín and Atocha, the nearest metro stops, are just 5-3 minutes away, respectively, so it’s easy to get around by metro if you wish. The apartment is also walking distance to Atocha, which is your arrival point if you get into town by train or with the shuttle train/bus from the airport.
Access: The apartment is composed by: * A living room with stylish, functional and warm, decoration, including a sofa (which turns into a 135 cm bed) and 26" TV. It has also a vintage deco desk perfect for those who are coming for work. This area includes and dining table bar for 4 people and the open plan kitchen, which is fully equipped with anything you need to cook and eat, including the stove, microwave,  and refrigerator.  * The double bed is upstairs and underneath the bed structure there is a chest of drawers.    * A spacious bathroom with a nice and comfortable shower and lots of natural light.   * Wi-Fi is also available during your stay, how not ;) Also, there are individual aircon units for the summer and heating for the winter. Of course, fresh linen and towels are provided, as well as iron, etc. If you think there is something missing, we'll be happy to have your feedback in order to continue improving the apartment.
Interaction: Upon your arrival, one of us will be there to greet you and provide you with all sorts of information we’ve prepared to make your stay smooth, pleasant and enjoyable. And we're available at any time during your stay for any questions, including a 24/7 emergency number.

Host About:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer. However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 18 years now and now has enrolled in her new adventure: becoming a mum in spring 2017. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board. Firstly Paula, a Venezuelan that has been living in Madrid for 10 years now, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Paula is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Nuria, whom you'll see on weekends and public holidays (and more often when the baby will be born and Vanessa will disappear for a while).

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens. We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 


We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Vanessa_Oscar_Paula (& Nuria)

Los propietarios viven muy cerca del apartamento, y están disponibles al teléfono en cualquier momento para atender cualquier requerimiento de los huéspedes La zona de Arguelles está rodeada del Parque del Oeste, una preciosa zona verde con árboles centenarios donde se encuentra el Templo de Debod, transportado en
Neighborhood Overview: La zona de Arguelles está rodeada del Parque del Oeste, una preciosa zona verde con árboles centenarios donde se encuentra el Templo de Debod, transportado en el año 1969 desde Egipto a España. La zona está llena de pequeños comercios, y tabernas y restaurantes. Una selección de tabernas y restaurantes de tapas las encontrarán los huéspedes en la guía en la casa. A 5 minutos está el Faro de Moncloa, un mirador especial para tener una visión completa de Madrid. La zona está a 10 minutos andando de la Plaza de España y de la famosa Gran Vía, a 15 minutos andando del Palacio Real y toda la zona del Madrid de los Austrias. La ubicación es perfecta para conocer lo mejor de Madrid.
Transit: A 5 minutos andando hay estación de Metro, y el intercambiador de Moncloa, de donde parte metro y autobuses para todas las zonas de Madrid.
Access: El piso está en una 4ª planta, muy luminoso. La finca dispone de ascensor. Existe calefacción central, y aparato de aire refrigerado para el verano.
Interaction: Los propietarios viven muy cerca del apartamento, y están disponibles al teléfono en cualquier momento para atender cualquier requerimiento de los huéspedes
House Rules: Sólo se admiten reservas para un mínimo de 2 noches. El día de salida, salvo que se acuerde otra cosa, deberá dejarse el apartamento a las 12:00, para permitir la limpieza y cambios para los nuevos huéspedes.  Por lo demás, las normas habituales de educación entre los que compartimos nuestras casas para disfrutarlas.
Host About:
I like very much travelling around the world with my family; my wife, daughter and son. We really like to meet people from other culture, try new food and listen new music.
Unfortunately, our jobs dont let my wife and me much available time to do it. Anyway, one of the most comfortable ways to travel is hiring apartments. He have done it a lot of times, and the experiences have been always not only positive, but fantastic.

Name: Elegant apartment in exclusive area-Claudio Coello
Summary: This striking 3-bed sits regally within the most sought-after area of Madrid. Perched by the corner of Claudio Coello and Ayala, the apartment lies within the very heart of barrio Salamanca, home to some of the city's most distinguished residents.
Space: The apartment itself is characterised by its beautiful open-plan living space that incorporates two separate sitting rooms that can be left open for a sense of space. Alternatively, the sliding doors can be used to create a third bedroom, as the sofa pulls out into a comfortable bed for two. The fully-equipped modern kitchen is situated directly off the living room and is spacious enough to fit a dining table for six. Large and bright, the master bedroom has its own small living area which includes a sofa-bed for two people – ideal for children or additional guests. The second bedroom has been decorated in keeping with the rest of the property and each of the three bathrooms has been fully renovated in a traditional style, with clean lines and white tiling. Furnished with quality pieces throughout and with a fantastic location in the barrio Salamanca, this is an excellent choice for a holiday in the Spanish capital. [Cl. Coello VII]
Description: This striking 3-bed sits regally within the most sought-after area of Madrid. Perched by the corner of Claudio Coello and Ayala, the apartment lies within the very heart of barrio Salamanca, home to some of the city's most distinguished residents. The apartment itself is characterised by its beautiful open-plan living space that incorporates two separate sitting rooms that can be left open for a sense of space. Alternatively, the sliding doors can be used to create a third bedroom, as the sofa pulls out into a comfortable bed for two. The fully-equipped modern kitchen is situated directly off the living room and is spacious enough to fit a dining table for six. Large and bright, the master bedroom has its own small living area which includes a sofa-bed for two people – ideal for children or additional guests. The second bedroom has been decorated in keeping with the rest of the property and each of the three bathrooms has been fully renovated in a traditional style, with clean lines an
Neighborhood Overview: The apartment is situated in the very heart of barrio Salamanca, the most elegant and upmarket of all of Madrid’s neighbourhoods. Calle Serrano - often considered as the city’s answer to New York’s 5th Avenue – is just a stone’s throw away, and is home to a host of designer stores, stylish boutiques and great restaurants and cafes. The impressive Plaza Colon and historic National Library are just a short walk away.
Notes: Please, note that the apartment features one double beds, two single beds and two double sofa-beds.
Transit: The area boasts good transport connections with several metro stations and bus stops all close by, while the nearby "Paseo de la Castellana" leads onto some of the city’s top sights and attractions, including the art deco, famous "Gran Via" strip and the “Big Three” art museums.
Access: Surface Area: 130m2. Third floor. The entrance leads into a spacious living / dining area furnished with an elegant 3-seater leather sofa with side tables on both sides, 2 cream-colored single armchairs, 2 footstools that can also be used as seating, a wooden center table, and a flat-screen TV with a DVD player. Adjacent to the living room is the first of three bedrooms with 2 large French windows the lead onto balconies. This room is furnished with a desk, reading chair, coffee table and a sofa-bed for 2 (1.40m x 2.00m). This room can be closed off from the living room thanks to a large sliding wooden door. It has an additional door that also connects to the second bedroom next door which is furnished with 2 single beds (0.90 x 2.00m), bedside tables and a reading chair. This room also has a walk-in closet and an en-suite bathroom with a shower. The main bedroom is found at the back of the apartment and is furnished with a queen sized bed (1.60, x 2.00m), bedside tables, a desk, and a
Interaction: We will arrange the check in time depending on your arrival time. It is normally from 4pm but we will do our best to have the apartment ready for you ASAP. Anything you need during your stay, feel free to contact us! We are happy to help!
House Rules: Arrivals after 21:00 may be subject to an extra charge. Remember to let us know your arrival time in advance! *We ask our guests to sign a rental agreement upon arrival and leave details of a credit card as a further security measure. This information will be destroyed after you have left the property and we have conducted a check-out inspection*
Host About:
Spain Select was born from the recognition of a desire among travelers to live locally in a real home whilst away from their own, and yet still enjoy all of the benefits and small luxuries of a hotel stay. Not only that, though, we understood that they also wanted to be close to all of the best that their destination has to offer – to be right in the heart of it all. So we decided to source a broad range of high quality homes in the most sought after locations across the country, starting with the capital Madrid and moving over to Malaga, Valencia, and Seville. We then added a few unique flourishes that embody our brand of service and our values. Our interior design team works to extract and enhance the natural charm from each space and make it a warm home. Our very own in-house Local Ambassadors are posted in each destination to welcome each guest home and bed them in to the neighborhood when they first arrive. Finally, a selection of hotel-like services – including a 24-hour concierge for everything from show tickets to new sheets – and a motorized maintenance team completes our comprehensive customer care throughout every single stay. Every Spain Select experience is unique, yet they are all of a consistent high quality no matter when you stay with us. 

Live local, sleep royal: welcome to Spain Select.

Neighborhood Overview: Es un barrio muy bonito, tranquilo, seguro de dia y de noche y muy bien comnunicado con cualquier punto de la ciudad, tanto en metro como en bus o coche. Está lleno de bares, restaurantes para tapear o comer muy bien, asi como supermercados y sitios donde tomar una copa, cines, etc.
Notes: La casa es muy silenciosa y luminosa a pesar de estar en el Centro. No da a la calle principal por lo que los ruidos son inexistentes. Transit: La zona está muy bien comunicada por metro, con 4 lineas de metro en Avenida de America y diego de Leon. Autobuses a cualquier sitio de la ciudad y aeropuerto, asi como estacion de autobuses para todas las ciudades del Noreste de España, Barcelona, Bilbao, Zaragoza, Santander, etc.

House Rules: El de personas educadas y civilizadas, ya que la casa está cuidada e impecablemente amueblada, ideal para estancias románticas o familiares pero siempre manteniendo las cosas como están.
Host About: Mi nombre es Carmen y soy una apasionada de viajar y conocer gentes y ciudades de todo el mundo, cosa que he hecho gracias a mi trabajo como Organizadora de Eventos. Actualmente soy Coach personal especializada en "autoestima e imagen interior y exterior".  Me encanta la decoración y la moda como aficiones. La casa que alquilo es muy acogedora y elegante y un remanso de paz en el centro de Madrid. Me encargo personalmente de ella por lo que yo os daria la bienvenida y os orientaría y explicaría los sitios donde ir en la ciudad y alrededores, ya que nací en Madrid y lo conozco muy bien. Además os  daré trucos y sitios de gran interés pero menos turísticos, dependiendo de vuestros gustos y aficciones, donde podréis iir, ya que yo como viajera del mundo, sé que a veces lo menos turístico es lo quemás gusta! Estaré encantada de daros la bienvenida en mi casa, donde os encontrareis como en la vuestra.. Hasta pronto!!!

Name: Casa grande y luminosa.
Summary: Nuestro apartamento esta situado en un enclave estratégico, esta en el centro de Madrid pero con acceso rápido a las carreteras y a menos de un minuto del intercambiador de Avenida de America tanto para desplazarte por Madrid como autobuses y metro hasta el aeropuerto.
Space: Definiría a mi casa como una "casa en la que apetece estar" . Todas las estancias son amplias; la pared del salón es una cristalera sin ningún edificio delante asi que gozamos de abundante luz natural todo el día. Tenemos una gran cocina en la que pasamos mucho tiempo puesto que nos gusta bastante cocinar. Hablamos idiomas por lo que nos gusta que vengan extranjeros. Aceptamos mascotas.

Name: cozy room in a perfect location to explore Madrid
Summary: Next to the very city center (5min walking to the Royal Palace). Also surrounded by huge parks and the river promenade (Madrid Río). Next to the old station Principe Pio (with train, underground, city buses & long distance buses). The room is suitable for lonely travellers or couples, with a confortable double bed. It´s perfect to use it as a “base camp” to explore Madrid. It has no window but just across the living room there is a balcony to smoke or simply enjoy a cup of coffe :)

The main attractions are really close walking (10 min to the Roy
Neighborhood Overview: El barrio es muy tranquilo pero a la vez muy cerca a la famosa Gran Vía: la calle más transitada de España. Si te gusta hacer deporte o simplemente pasear aprovecha la cercanía con Madrid Río: un enorme enclave lúdico y cultural estrenado en 2011 que cuenta con zonas deportivas, circuitos de running, alquiler de bicis y varios restaurantes y terrazas.
Notes: Se sei uno sportivo sarai felice di sapere che a due passi da casa potrai correre, andare in bici, allenarti, pattinare o semplicemente passeggiare tra i vari circuiti del nuovissimo parco Madrid Río o addentrarti nella verde tranquillità della Casa de Campo: il polmone di Madrid.
Transit: The main attractions are really close walking (10 min to the Royal Palace and Granvía, 20 min to Puerta del Sol). It's easy to use public transportation too (bus, underground and overground trains). Local trains (CERCANÍAS) go straight to Atocha Railway station and to Terminal 4  airport. If you come from all the other terminals take line 8 (METRO) till Nuevos Ministerios then switch to line 10 till Príncipe Pío (30 minutes more or less).
Access: You may use the kitchen if you need to: it has a microwave oven, stoves, a kettle, a moka (italian traditional coffee-machine)  and a dishwasher.
Interaction: We'll be able to help you for anything you need about citysight-seeing, tourist information, events, night-life, museums&expositions, bars and restaurants, reservations for one day tryps to the surroundings of Madrid (Toledo, Ávila, Segovia, El Escorial, Aranjuez...etc) and we'll give a free city map.
House Rules: - We have neighbours and we work a lot so we ask you to be very careful with the noise from 22h - Please keep the house the same way it was before, whenever you make use of it.

Name: Madrid City Centre.
Summary: The apartment is located in the area of Lavapiés in Madrid.  Comfortable and quiet one bedroom apartment, located in the heart of the city, Lavapies area in a walking distance to Plaza Mayor and 10 min. to the Prado.  It is ideal for 2 adults, or 2 adults with a baby or children.

The kitchen is open to the living room and equipped with everything you need. Washing machine, microwave, oven, toaster, kettle... The bedroom is spacious and very quiet.  Double bed. Comfortable and quiet one bedroom apartment, located in the heart of the city, Lavapies area in a walking distance to Plaza Mayor and 10 min. to the Prado.  It is ideal for 2 adults, or 2 adults with a baby or children. The living room is bright with to large windows with tipical balconies, a comfortable sofa, a dining table, tv,  and air conditioning. The apartment is beautifully clean and fully-equipped with sheets and towels, kitchen equipment (washing machine, refrigerator, microwave, dishes, coffee maker, kettle, iron). Bathroom with hair dryer, shower gel, and shampoo. Travel cot available on request. Heating.
Neighborhood Overview: Where the apartment is located is multinational and full or different cultures and people.  You are within walking distance of all the main spots: Royal Palace, Prado Museum, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Museums, el Rastro, Retiro Park, Atocha train station, etc.
Notes: You will enjoy your stay!
Transit: Getting there is very easy with Metro Line 1 (Tirso de Molina or Antón Martín Stations) or Line 3 (Lavapiés).  Bus line runing from Metro Sevilla (Calle Sevilla-Alcalá) to Embajadores is right on the corner.

Bathroom with hair dryer, shower gel, and shampoo. Travel cot available on request. Heating. WiFi included. Air conditioning in the living room.

During check-in, we will give you information about places to visit, nearby restaurants, nice walks, museums, etc. We will welcome you to the flat at the agreed time and explain how everything works. We are available for any questions you might have throughout your stay.

Host About:
I am a very open person, I like travelling, meeting people, reading, sports, culture... open air life and walks in the forest, mountains and beaches. 
I speak fluent English, Spanish, French, Portuguese and some German. 
Because of my work I need to travel a lot around Europe and I might be frequently outside Madrid, but my colleague Ricardo is supporting me when I am not in the city so he will welcome and take care of you during your stay.

Name: Sofá a 5min del centro (Atocha, Sol) 10€
Summary: Hola! Mi piso es muy luminoso y está muy bien conectado con el resto de Madrid Capital. Con un metro a 500 metros directo a Sol (20min), y a una estación de Atocha en cercanías (5min). 1h desde el aeropuerto en transporte público. Rodeado de parques y en una zona tranquila.
Space: Tened en cuenta: -El sofá es el de las fotos, no es sofá cama, es un sofá normal. -El sofá está en el salón, y usamos el salón para comer. -También hay que pasar por el salón para acceder al resto de la casa. -No hagáis ruido de noche, en casa vive gente que está estudiando/trabajando.
Description: Hola! Mi piso es muy luminoso y está muy bien conectado con el resto de Madrid Capital. Con un metro a 500 metros directo a Sol (20min), y a una estación de Atocha en cercanías (5min). 1h desde el aeropuerto en transporte público. Rodeado de parques y en una zona tranquila. Tened en cuenta: -El sofá es el de las fotos, no es sofá cama, es un sofá normal. -El sofá está en el salón, y usamos el salón para comer. -También hay que pasar por el salón para acceder al resto de la casa. -No hagáis ruido de noche, en casa vive gente que está estudiando/trabajando. Cualquier cosa que necesitéis suelo estar en casa, y si no pues al móvil sin problema. Se trata de un barrio obrero al sur de Madrid. Tranquilo y con pequeños comercios y parques cerca. Mayormente compuesto por familias inmigrantes y nacionales ya ancianos. Precio billete cercanías: 1,70€ Precio billete metro: 1,50€ Usad Maps (app), es lo que yo uso par ir a cualquier lado y os va a indicar mejor que yo (yo lo uso cuando me preguntáis
Neighborhood Overview: Se trata de un barrio obrero al sur de Madrid. Tranquilo y con pequeños comercios y parques cerca. Mayormente compuesto por familias inmigrantes y nacionales ya ancianos.
Notes: -Podéis fumar lo que queráis, pero siempre en el balcón. -Podéis traer a vuestra mascota, pero siempre bajo vuestro cuidado constante, y sin dar ningún tipo de problema (olor, suciedad, ruido...). -No pongáis los zapatos o demás cosas que huelan mal en el salón, si no en el balcón o si llueve en la entrada. Insisto en que comemos ahí. -La casa no va a estar perfecta en el sentido limpieza, vivimos varias personas aquí, no puedo estar limpiando cada diez horas para que todo reluzca. Nos turnamos para limpiar día sí día no, pero la casa se ensucia rápido. -Recordad que me estáis pagando 10€/día, esto no va a ser un 5 estrellas. -No vamos a cambiar nuestra rutina de vida por contentaros. Si me gusta ver Shin Chan a las 6am mientras me tomo un Cola-cao, lo seguiré haciendo aunque estéis durmiendo en el sofá. -Si no estáis de acuerdo con todo lo mencionado aquí, no reservéis. No quiero llevarme una mala evaluación simplemente porque no os hayáis molestado en leer la descripción.
Transit: Precio billete cercanías: 1,70€ Precio billete metro: 1,50€ Usad Maps (app), es lo que yo uso par ir a cualquier lado y os va a indicar mejor que yo (yo lo uso cuando me preguntáis). El metro está más cerca pero tarda más asi que os recomiendo usar el cercanías.
Interaction: Cualquier cosa que necesitéis suelo estar en casa, y si no pues al móvil sin problema.
Host About: Hola! Soy un chaval de Galicia que vive en Madrid, dado que estoy estudiando aviación aquí. También he vivido en Andalucía y en Londres. Me gusta viajar (novedad en airbnb), pero más en moto que en coche, y más en coche que en avión... en barco sólo he cruzado el estrecho, pero seguro que molaría!! He trabajado de muchas cosas distintas en varias ciudades. Ahora alquilo mi sofá para sacarme unos eurillos, y de vez en cuando conocer a alguien interesante mientras ceno o practicar mi english intentando explicar como funcionan los fuegos haha. Hablo español, chapurreo inglés y tengo buen dominio del portugués, pero portugués muy al norte eh (gallego más bien haha). A veces tengo crisis existenciales (como todo el mundo alguna vez, no?), pero me veo el Shin Chan mientras me tomo un Cola-Cao y se me pasa haha. Me gusta explorar sitios abandonados, el bosque, la nieve, el mar... por eso a veces corro muchos riesgos innecesarios! No soy mucho de ciudad!! Y para terminar, que seguro que no os lo esperáis, también me gusta leer libros sobre bolsa y ver vídeos sobre ciencia! Bueno, nos vemos!
Street: Villaverde, Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid 28021, Spain

Name: Beautiful and modern apartment in the center

Neighborhood Overview: Chueca is undoubtedly the most cosmopolitan neighborhood in Madrid. It is often compared to SOHO in New York. The neighborhood of Chueca stands out for its narrow streets, full of bars, restaurants and shops, and for its active nightlife and daytime. The neighborhood is in constant development, with rehabilitation of buildings, shops, restaurants and premises. All this process of change coexists with remains of the more traditional Madrid. It is considered as an emblematic neighborhood of Madrid by tourists who visit the city.

Host About:
Hola Viajeros!
Soy Pablo de la empresa Mi Casa Inn. 

En Mi Casa Inn llevamos muchos años encontrando las mejores ubicaciones, decorando y dotándolas de todo lo necesario para ofreceros la mejor estancia en Madrid a un buen precio.
Tenemos diferentes opciones de alojamiento:

- Apartamentos y lofts de diseño, dando un servicio  a huéspedes de corta estancia que busquen espacios nuevos, modernos y céntricos de la ciudad. Dándolos con la máxima limpieza, toda la privacidad, confianza y seguridad que necesitan para sus vacaciones o viajes de negocios.

- Residencias premium de estudiantes internacionales por todo el mundo. Para quienes deseen alojarse en un ambiente más juvenil. 

Mi Casa Inn lo forman diferentes departamentos: Booking, Mantenimiento, Limpieza, Seguridad y Administración por lo que estarás totalmente cubierto y tendrás un servicio perfecto durante toda tu estancia. 

Estaré encantado de recibiros en nuestros apartamentos, un sueño para cualquier viajero cosmopolita, serán tan acogedores como tu propia casa y completamente equipados. 
Nuestros apartamentos y lofts son sitios ideales donde me gustaría alojarme en uno de mis viajes a cualquier ciudad con una ubicación excepcional.
----
Hello Travelers!
I am Pablo from the company Mi Casa Inn.

In Mi Casa Inn we have been many years finding the best locations, decorating and giving them everything necessary to offer you the best stay in Madrid at a good price.
We have different accommodation options:

- Design apartments and lofts, giving a service to short stay guests looking for new, modern and central spaces of the city. Giving them with the maximum cleaning, all the privacy, confidence and security that they need for their vacations or business trips.

- Premium residences for international students all over the world. For those who wish to stay in a more youthful environment.

My House Inn is made up of different departments: Booking, Maintenance, Cleaning, Security and Administration so you will be fully covered and you will have a perfect service throughout your stay.

I will be delighted to welcome you in our apartments, a dream for any cosmopolitan traveler, will be as welcoming as your own and fully equipped.
Our apartments and lofts are ideal places where I would like to stay in one of my trips to any city with an exceptional location.

Host About:
Vivo en el apartamento de uno de mis hermanos, gestionando el alquiler de las otras habitaciones. 
En cuanto a mi, disfruto yendo a la montaña y al mar, y viajando en general. También cantando y bailando, y disfrutando de una buena cena con buena compañía. Si la compañía es de origen variado, y habla distintos idiomas, mejor. 
Llevo muchos años compartiendo piso, y he tenido ocasión de conocer gente de muchos sitios. Con la mayoría conservo una buena relación, incluso de amistad. 
Mi frase sería: "por si te mueres mañana, no te quedes con ganas de nada"

Name: Piso de diseño en el centro
Summary: Este céntrico piso, decorado de manera moderna, sencilla y muy cómodo, se encuentra a 2 minutos del metro Tirso de Molina y a 5 minutos del metro Sol. La estación de trenes de Atocha se encuentra a menos de 15 minutos a pie.
Space: Mi casa es cómoda y práctica, moderna y siempre ordenada y muy limpia. Es espaciosa y está en pleno centro. Hay un parking justo en frente donde puedes alquilar un coche si te hace falta o dejar el que traigas. Hay supermercados en la misma calle, zonas para pasear, comer, divertirse y relajarse. ¡Ojalá pudiera pasar más tiempo aquí!
Description: Este céntrico piso, decorado de manera moderna, sencilla y muy cómodo, se encuentra a 2 minutos del metro Tirso de Molina y a 5 minutos del metro Sol. La estación de trenes de Atocha se encuentra a menos de 15 minutos a pie. Mi casa es cómoda y práctica, moderna y siempre ordenada y muy limpia. Es espaciosa y está en pleno centro. Hay un parking justo en frente donde puedes alquilar un coche si te hace falta o dejar el que traigas. Hay supermercados en la misma calle, zonas para pasear, comer, divertirse y relajarse. ¡Ojalá pudiera pasar más tiempo aquí! Tendrás acceso a toda la casa menos a mi oficina/almacén, donde guardo mis papeles y libros :) Si estás en casa, significa que yo no estaré, pero mi vecina os atenderá en todo lo que podáis necesitar sin ningún problema. El barrio está lleno de restaurantes, cines, zonas de ocio, librerías... es la zona más conocida de Madrid por sus galerías de arte y museos y el parque del Retiro está muy cerca. Los metros Tirso de Molina, Sol y La L
Neighborhood Overview: El barrio está lleno de restaurantes, cines, zonas de ocio, librerías... es la zona más conocida de Madrid por sus galerías de arte y museos y el parque del Retiro está muy cerca.
Transit: Los metros Tirso de Molina, Sol y La Latina están muy cerca (a 2', 5' y 7') La estación de trenes de Atocha se encuentra a 15 minutos andando bajando en línea recta. Si vas en coche, estás allí en 5.
Access: Tendrás acceso a toda la casa menos a mi oficina/almacén, donde guardo mis papeles y libros :)
Interaction: Si estás en casa, significa que yo no estaré, pero mi vecina os atenderá en todo lo que podáis necesitar sin ningún problema.
House Rules: Por favor, os pido que no fuméis en casa. Yo no fumo y lo noto mucho... Como tengo dos ventanas enormes que dan a la calle, si lo necesitáis, os pido que fuméis en el balcón. Además, si podéis caminar descalzos por las alfombras os lo agradeceré. Yo lo hago y quiero que os sintáis como en casa! Gracias!!
Host About:
Soy brasileño de nacimiento, pero he pasado los últimos años entre Portugal y España, donde vivo actualmente por trabajo.
Trabajo en la TV, y por eso viajo muchísimo y pocas veces estoy largas temporadas en casa. 
Soy una persona muy sociable y divertida; me gusta conocer gente nueva y no parar de aprender cosas nuevas. Tanto es así, que me llevo de maravilla con mi vecina, que me da clases de español. Seguramente será ella la que os atienda, porque es probable que yo esté de viaje por algún sitio del mundo cuando vengáis! 
Espero que disfrutéis de la casa tanto como yo cuando tengo oportunidad ;)
Street: Embajadores, Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid 28012, Spain

Neighborhood Overview: I live in a very "typical spanish" neighborhood, full of bars, markets, shops... It is close to the emblematic Toledo Bridge and green areas for walking, jogging, skating, bike renting ... As the Atlético de Madrid stadium is nearby, when soccer match the streets are full of live. This neighborhood is also where the festivities are held in Madrid on May 15th.
Transit: Between my home and Marqués de Vadillo metro station there ar 200 meters. Line 5 connects directly with La Latina, Opera, Gran Via, Chueca... There are also several buses to Plaza Mayor, Atocha, Cibeles ... and at night, there are two night buses coming from the center of Madrid (N26 and N15). If you come by car, the neighborhood allows free parking in the streets. The apartment is next to the entrance of one of the main ring roads, so getting in and out of Madrid is very fast.
Access: I live alone in the apartment. Guests have at your disposal a private bathroom (you need to leave the room to access it), and you can also use the lounge, office, the terrace and the kitchen, which has all kinds of appliances. The house has heating and air conditioning, and the block has an elevator.
Interaction: I have to travel for work from time to time, but if I am at home I will be pleased to help you in everything you need. During the weekends, I usually go out all aroud the city centre because I do improv as a hobby, so if I have any show I'll be happy to invite you to come to the theatre.
House Rules: Due to allergy issues, pets can not be accepted and smoking is not allowed except on the terrace. For ecological responsibility, I ask my guests not waste water and electricity and make responsible use of the place and utilities at their disposal.
Host About: Me encanta viajar tanto con mis amigos como sola, y conocer gente de todo el mundo. Después del trabajo me gusta hacer diversas actividades: canto en un coro, hago teatro de improvisación en una pequeña compañía de Madrid, bailo... también me encanta salir con mis amigos de cañas, salir a pasear por el río y leer.

Neighborhood Overview: Chueca is the gay epicenter of Madrid and a symbol of modernity, art and tolerance. In its streets is easy to have fun, fashion and environment. The Chueca district is located in the downtown area of the city of Madrid and has the Plaza de Chueca and the streets Fuencarral and Hortaleza main axes. In recent years, this area has become the standard of freedom and openness of Madrid society harboring numerous frequented by the LGBT community, alternative centers of fashion and fun and relaxed atmosphere. It's a neighborhood to enjoy fashion because there are shops of all kinds: from the latest designs to leading brands, including facilities for virtually any urban tribe. They are also streets to enjoy with friends and night because it has numerous local holiday, either to quietly enjoy a drink or dance until the wee hours. Similarly, there are many gastronomic restaurants design, popular or international cuisine. And all in an atmosphere of tolerance and diversity. Chueca each year is al

Take line 8 (pink line, towards Mar de Cristal) to the Nuevos Ministerios, there connection with line 6 (gray line, direction Moncloa) to stop Cuatro Caminos. Finally, take line 1 (blue line, direction Valdecarros) to stop Gran Vía. Bus: (phone number hidden) lines stop at Puerta del Sol Plza 5-120 lines will leave Anton Martin, just 5 min from the hotel.. The nearest underground stations are line 1 (blue line) and line 5 (green line) and get off at Gran Vía.

Neighborhood Overview: To let yourself into the Barrio de las Letras is to plunge into the living history of the Spanish Golden Age. The framework of the neighborhood suggests, with every step we take, the prose and verse of Calderón, Lope de Vega, Quevedo and so many men and women that with their lived and written word have made this historical place so grand. The Barrio de las Letras boasts first class neighbors living in its surroundings: The Prado Museum, The Thyssen Museum, The Reina Sofía Arts Centre, and within its limits, the Medialab and the Caixa Forum. This artistic spirit makes the neighborhood a very special place to be, and also marks it as the place with the best Madrid has to offer: the so-called Art strip, that leads to the Madrid de los Austrias-Plaza Mayor-Puerta del Sol, and it is also very close to the Alcalá-Gran Vía zone, as well as Paseo de la Castellana, Colón and Serrano. Shopping in the Barrio de las Letras becomes a delight due to its wide and rich variety of shops, where quality
Notes: Check in time is at 3pm or later, although sometimes I may manage to let you in before, so just ask. If you arrive later than 11pm there will be a small late check-in fee of 15€ to be paid at arrival. The front door is self-locking. Please do not leave the keys in the apartment while you are still in the city. Upon checkout, please just leave the keys on the living room table and  close the door behind you. The checkout time is anytime before 12pm unless you have agreed to checkout at a different time in advance. Our housekeeper will usually come at 12pm, in which case, please let her in!

Host About:
Hi I'm Elena!

I travel a lot - for work and - the best part - also for pleasure. I love meeting new people, tasting new food, experiencing new cultures. I have lived in different countries and continents so traveling is very much part of my DNA as well as my life experience. I have used Airbnb in the past and I am now happy to host fellow travelers.

I live in Madrid but I spend most of my time traveling so I have decided to share my beautiful apartment with you.

But don't worry, you will be well taken care of when I am not in town thanks to my friends at Minty Host, who are there to help my guests with anything they need. On my side, I will be more than happy to share with you the Madrid I love - its main landmarks but also its fantastic restaurants, bright squares, and bustling bars.

Enjoy your stay!

*** 
Hola soy Elena!

Soy una persona curiosa y es lo que me ha llevado a vivir en distintos países, conocer culturas y viajar mucho.

Vivo en en Madrid pero estoy prácticamente todo el tiempo fuera por viajes, así que he decidido compartir este increíble apartamento con todos. Pero no os preocupéis, estaréis muy bien atendidos ya que mis amigos de Minty Host me ayudan a cuidar a mis huéspedes cuando no estoy en la ciudad.

Me encanta viajar y todo tipo de viajes, de ocio y descanso, de turismo, de aventura, a grandes ciudades, pequeños pueblos o lugares salvajes, con familia, amigos o incluso solo. Disfruto mucho conociendo gente y aprendiendo de sus culturas.

He utilizado Airbnb para viajar en numerosas ocasiones y ahora me he decidido a ser anfitriona. Me gusta ofrecer un buen servicio, que la gente quede encantada de la experiencia y que disfruten en la vivienda, del barrio y de la ciudad en la que he vivido gran parte de mi vida y de la que estaré encantada de compartir sus mejores secretos.

Os invito a disfrutar de la estancia!
