Name: Lavapies Rocks!
Summary: Very quiet apartment in Lavapies. One of the best neighbourhood in town, intercultural, open minded and full of life.10 mins. to Sol and Plaza Mayor. Very bright, tastefully furnished, self-service breakfast included, wi-fi, A/C and fully equipped.
Space: ***NEW! WITH AIR CONDITIONING*** Apartment of 30 m2. Distributed in two rooms. The first salon with terrace and kitchenette and the second room with bathroom inside.  The apartment has lots of natural light and is very quiet.  It's on a second floor -without elevator-. The living room has a large sofa bed 1'60 wide. A table with chairs and a balcony: a great place to enjoy the good weather. The bed 1'50x1'90m, brand new and really comfy.
Description: Very quiet apartment in Lavapies. One of the best neighbourhood in town, intercultural, open minded and full of life.10 mins. to Sol and Plaza Mayor. Very bright, tastefully furnished, self-service breakfast included, wi-fi, A/C and fully equipped. ***NEW! WITH AIR CONDITIONING*** Apartment of 30 m2. Distributed in two rooms. The first salon with terrace and kitchenette and the second room with bathroom inside.  The apartment has lots of natural light and is very quiet.  It's on a second floor -without elevator-. The living room has a large sofa bed 1'60 wide. A table with chairs and a balcony: a great place to enjoy the good weather. The bed 1'50x1'90m, brand new and really comfy. Wi-fi and local phone calls.  Fully equipped kitchen (cooker, toaster, sandwich maker, oven, microwave, refrigerator, kettel,  etc..). Plus basic kitchen supplies (salt, vinager, sugar, olive oil, etc.) Living room with stereo and TV with DVD.  Terrace with tables and chairs and clothesline.  Washing machine
Neighborhood Overview: Artistic, cultural, brave and multicultural neighborhood is the historic center of Madrid, traditional and bohemian on merit.  A very real neighborhood where people of Madrid live in full coexistence with immigration as part of our history and identity over the years.
Notes: The check in/check out schedule is flexible as far as there are not other reservations on the same date of entry or exit.  If there would be Check in: From 16:00.  Check out: before 11:00  If you need to stay longer we will always find a solution for your bags and luggage.
Transit: Perfectly situated in the heart of Madrid, you can walk to the main points downtown and if you need public transport you have different subway and bus stops near by and Atocha (main train station), everything on a walking distance. Within 5 minutes walking to the Plaza de Tirso de Molina (Metro L1) and the Plaza de Lavapies (L3). 10 minutes from Sol (L1, L2, L3), La Latina (L5) and Atocha (L1 and Cercanías and long distance trains).
Access: Wi-fi and local phone calls.  Fully equipped kitchen (cooker, toaster, sandwich maker, oven, microwave, refrigerator, kettel,  etc..). Plus basic kitchen supplies (salt, vinager, sugar, olive oil, etc.) Living room with stereo and TV with DVD.  Terrace with tables and chairs and clothesline.  Washing machine and ironing for guests use too. Bathroom with small bath and hairdryer.  You will have free tea and coffee and biscuits, cereal, etc. at your disposal so that you can prepare a light breakfast and take energy to start the day. Profesional cleaning service including in the price.
Interaction: I'll personally receive you on your arrival to welcome you at home, show you around and give you all the information you need to prepare your trip and explore the neighborhood and the city of Madrid.  In the lounge you will find several guides of Madrid in various languages, maps and all kinds of updated tourist information.  I work in the Tourist Information Centre so depending on your wills and likes I can I give you all kinds of tips and practical information to explore the city and surrounding area.
House Rules: The apartment is located in a community with a familiar and quiet condominium. Please don't make noise after 11 pm on weekdays (12 pm on weekends) as is important to respect the rest of neighbours.  Not need of cleaning at your departure but please leave the house tidy.  If you want to smoke can do so on the terrace or the windows, but we kindly ask you not to smoke inside the apartment. Other rules appeal to common sense more than anything else, not making much noise, care for furniture and appliances and leave the house tidy.
Host About:
We have both born in Madrid. And we are friends since many years ago. Alfredo studied Tourism and Socio-Cultural Education and Rafa Geology but both of us have been always working in the so called "third sector" organisations and NGOs for development, were we both met. 
We are both avid travellers, have travelled and lived in a few countries. We can speak 5 languages (some better than others) and have always enjoyed getting to know other cultures and lifestyles.

We like Madrid and enjoy walking the streets, neighbourhoods, shops and exhibitions, we think we can guide you to discover a city which does not always go on maps and guidebooks.
In short, we'll do my best to make you feel comfortable in our apartments and to enjoy this city as the best.


Los dos somos Madrileños de nacimiento, buenos amigos desde hace muchos años. Alfredo estudió Turismo y Animación Sociocultural y Rafa Geología. Aunque siempre hemos trabajado en el llamado "tercer sector" en asociaciones y ONGs de Cooperación al desarrollo, donde nos conocimos. 
Los dos somos unos viajeros empedernidos -hemos viajado y vivido en unos cuantos países-.
Hablamos 5 idiomas (unos mejor que otros) y siempre hemos disfrutado conociendo otras culturas y estilos de vida.

Nos encanta Madrid y disfrutamos recorriendo sus calles, sus barrios, sus tiendas y exposiciones, creo que podemos orientarte para descubrir un Madrid que no siempre sale en los mapas y las guías turísticas. 
En definitiva, haremos lo posible para que te sientas a gusto en nuestros apartamentos y para que descubres el mejor de los Madriles.

Name: WORK AND LIVE IN MADRID
Summary: It´s a good combination between a nice house in the centre of Madrid and a desk in a interesting work space, "La Fábrica de Cajas"only 5 minutes walk from the house.
Space: HOME In the old days, the entrance door of this 1852 classical styled building allowed carriages into a yard. The place is very romantic. There is an old French fireplace operating. With plenty of natural light; 8 windows.  Relax while you have breakfast in an indoor gallery surrounded by plants or read a good book on the hammock. If you like modern places, this is not for you. If you love vintage things and different places this would become your own home for a few days. Located in the heart of the city, in the hip and trendy neighborhood of Malasaña, this house is amazingly silent and sometimes you would only hear the birds singing.  THE WORKING SPACE You also have a place at La Fábrica de Cajas, a nicely decorated, quite, familiar and full of natural light working place, only 5 minutes walk from the house. Situated in Conde Duque, a small village in the city centre that you’ll really love. Its architecture is rather uniform, with most buildings ranging from 4 to 6 levels, each build

HOME In the old days, the entrance door of this 1852 classical styled building allowed carriages into a yard. The place is very romantic. There is an old French fireplace operating. THE WORKING SPACE You also have a place at La Fábrica de Cajas, a nicely decorated, quite, familiar and full of natural light working place, only 5 minutes walk from the house. Situated in C
Neighborhood Overview: Malasaña is a vibrant and genuine neighborhood and centre for the 'hipster' phenomena, full of lively bars and clubs overflowing. It´s culturally rich with theaters, exhibitions, gigs… The most stimulating area in terms of creativity.     The life is diverse in Malasaña. There are many second-hand vintage shops, used book stores and unique gift shops, sunny terraces, bohemian cafes, retro food shops, cool restaurants mixed with the most tradicional and authentic Spanish places. It has many fashion boutiques as well as design shops.     Malasaña is mentioned in scenes on films by Pedro Amodóvar. It was the centre of the movida movement in the late 70’s and 80’s in Madrid.
Transit: Only 5 minutes walk from Puerta del Sol, Callao, Gran Vía, and Chueca; and 10 minutes walk from every turistic place: Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, El Rastro… The subway station (Noviciado) is just 30 seconds away and many different buses stop by, but you don’t need to take any transport, walking is the most enjoyable way to get to know the city.
Access: The house offers a lot of space, 120 m2, with a semi-private living-room, an indoor gallery with plenty of natural light and a bedroom with a very comfy doublebed at your disposal.
Interaction: You’ll only find me if you want to: I will be very respectful if you love to be on your own, but if you want to know better the Spanish culture and Madrid I’ll be happy to be your guide. I also wrote a guide for you with the most authentic places.
Host About:
I’m an industrial and graphic designer, I really love vintage objects and furnitures. 

Last year I was living in London and I lived and worked in a culturally exciting warehouse. It was a very enriching experience for me, and I would like to replicate a similar concept in Madrid. Knowing a lot of interesting people and learning a lot of new things were the most important experiences for me living in the UK.

I’m living alone in this flat and I also have a working space,  La Fábrica de Cajas, a nicely decorated, quite, familiar and full of natural light working place, only 5 minutes walk from the house.
Street: Malasaña, Madrid, Community of Madrid 28004, Spain

Host About:
Hello, 
You're welcome to my apartment, where you will fell like home. The apartment has everything you need to feel comfortable.

In the apartment you have a lot of information about Madrid and its outskirts, we also recommend the nearby restaurants with typical and cheap menu.
You have the option of early or late check out, my husband and me are always available.
Apartments are perfectly cleanand comfortable you can find cleaning and hygienic products within as you can confirm reading the comments that others have made about the apartment
We look forward to see you here.

Hola,eres bienvenido a mi apartamento,te vas a encontrar como si fuera tu casa.Tiene todo lo necesario para sentirte comodo. 

En el apartamento tienes mucha información de Madrid y sus alrededores, también te recomendaremos los restaurantes cercanos en los que el menú es económico y típico.
Si llegas pronto o tarde para el checking, no te preocupes,  te esperamos mi marido o yo.
También te incluimos  productos de limpieza e higienicos 
Todo esta muy limpio y cómodo, solamente tienes que leer los comentarios que han hecho otros  del apartamento
“Hallo – 
seien Sie herzlich willkommen in meinem Apartment! Sie werden sich wie zuhause fühlen, denn Sie werden alles finden, was man zum Wohlfühlen braucht – fast so wie in einem Hotel.
Ich bin Leiterin eines Reisebüros, das sich hier im Gebäude befindet und wo wir Sie nicht nur beraten können, sondern auch alle gewünschten Buchungen für Sie vornehmen können: Reisen, Flüge, Bahnreisen, Ausflüge. 
Sie werden im Apartment ausführliche Information über Madrid und Umgebung finden, ebenso halten wir Empfehlungen über nahe gelegene Restaurants bereit, wo die Tagesmenus typisch spanisch und ausserdem preisgünstig sind.
Ob Sie früh oder spät zum check-in ankommen, mein Mann oder ich werden Sie erwarten.
Im Preis inbegriffen sind Bettwäsche, Decken und Handtücher sowie Hygiene –u. Reinigungsprodukte.
Alles ist einwandfrei sauber und bequem – lesen Sie nur die Kommentare anderer Gäste, die uns besucht haben.
Wir sind ganz einfach zu finden: Vom Flughafen aus erreichen Sie uns in 30 Minuten, vom Bahnhof aus in 10 Minuten.
Sie finden uns gleich neben der Puerta del Sol, in allernächster Nähe der Plaza Mayor, des Teatro Real etc., und Sie können von hier aus den gesamten Bereich des historischen Stadtkerns mit seinen Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuss erreichen.
Wir erwarten Sie gerne.
Ana.”

Neighborhood Overview: Está localizado en el corazón de la ciudad, o como lo llaman los Madrileños, “el Madrid de los Austrias” famoso por su historia, encanto y localización, puesto que se sitúa muy cerca del Palacio Real (al oeste de la Calle Mayor), y de la Plaza de Sol (300 metros).  El apartamento se sitúa muy cerca de uno de los mercados más famosos y turísticos de Madrid, el Mercado de San Miguel, que está pegado a la Plaza Mayor. A pesar de estar en una zona con mucho movimiento, el apartamento se sitúa en una calle muy tranquila y silenciosa. Muy cerca de la Plaza Mayor (5 minutos caminando), Cava Baja, el Rastro, Sol, Plaza de la Cebada, El Palacio Real, la Catedral de la Almudena, la estación de trenes de Atocha, el Museo del Prado, el Museo Reina Sofía y otros muchos puntos de interés turístico. Se encuentra muy cerca del barrio de La Latina, uno de los barrios míticos de Madrid. Se caracteriza por su ambiente bohemio, artístico y su amplia variedad de restaurantes de tapas, de pinchos y bares de
Transit: Se puede ir caminando a la mayoría de los sitios de interés de Madrid. La ubicación es simplemente excepcional ! Está a 1 minuto del metro de Tirso de Molina y a unos 5 minutos de Latina y Sol. La estación de Atocha esta también cerca.
Interaction: Me mantengo en contacto permanente con los huéspedes, desde que realizan la reserva, resolver las dudas que les pueda surgir acerca de la casa e incluso enviar información para preparar el viaje si es necesario. Les atenderé personalmente durante el check-in y checkout.

Our large modern kitchen has everything you need: microwave, oven, electric stove, large fridge and freezer, lots of light and a beautiful cooking island for a homey breakfast before heading out to town. Neighborhood Overview: Situated in the Goya area of the Salamanca neighborhood in the heart of Madrid, the Goya metro station is at the other end of our building. Madrid's metro system is very dense and will connect you very easily with two main lines running through our Goya station. Alternatively, you are a 10 minute walk away from the Retiro Park and 20 minutes from the Paseo de Castellana and Plaza de Cibeles. Best commercial area in Spain. About the pubs and bars, if you would like to chill or party a little bit, you wont have any problem living here as the house is located the most alternative and trendiest area in Madrid. The area counts with many well-known places such us La Flaca, Arts Club, Shuzo´s, Hoyo19, Tony2, Metropolitan, Black Jack,...  If, on the other hand, you are more of dinning or having a nice gastro experience, you will have where to choose, as there are many amazing restaurants nearby from many different cultures (european, spanish, italian, chinnese, indian,...) ; Ten con Ten, Maruc
Transit: The location of the building couldnt be better. Just in zone A, main central Madrid. Plenty of taxis and the best shops, restaurants and el Retiro Park at a short walk. Goya Underground Station (Line 2 and 4), Velazquez Tube Station (Line 4) is just five minutes walking from the house. There are many buses just one minute from the property. A great connection to everywhere.  Also I will definetly recomend the biciMAD bicicles. You'll get to know the city the best! take your time to get the oneday pass  on the TOTEM

Name: Calle Mayor, central, bright & elegant, AC (2D)
Summary: Spacious, fully renovated three-bedroom two-bathroom apartment in the very center of Madrid, a few steps from the famous Plaza Mayor, and a two-minute walk from the metro station in Puerta del Sol. The apartment comes with Wi-Fi, TV, all modern appliances and a fully equipped open kitchen. The reception on the ground floor is open daily from 9 am to 6 pm. Our team will be happy to help you with everything you need. The two sofa-beds in the living room accommodate two more guests.
Space: Three-bedroom two-bathroom apartment, ideal for groups of six people. All the bedrooms have double beds. There are two sofa-beds in the living room, sleeping up to two more people. The apartment is designed to be relaxing after a busy day visiting museums or exploring the city. Enjoy the comforts of this pretty apartment with fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and our special amenity package. There is also Wi-Fi, a flat-screen TV, a weekly cleaning service and home appliances such as a Nespresso coffee machine and a dishwasher, which will make your stay pleasant and easy.
Description: Spacious, fully renovated three-bedroom two-bathroom apartment in the very center of Madrid, a few steps from the famous Plaza Mayor, and a two-minute walk from the metro station in Puerta del Sol. The apartment comes with Wi-Fi, TV, all modern appliances and a fully equipped open kitchen. The reception on the ground floor is open daily from 9 am to 6 pm. Our team will be happy to help you with everything you need. The two sofa-beds in the living room accommodate two more guests. Three-bedroom two-bathroom apartment, ideal for groups of six people. All the bedrooms have double beds. There are two sofa-beds in the living room, sleeping up to two more people. The apartment is designed to be relaxing after a busy day visiting museums or exploring the city. Enjoy the comforts of this pretty apartment with fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and our special amenity package. There is also Wi-Fi, a flat-screen TV, a weekly cleaning service and home appliances such as a Nespresso coffee machine
Neighborhood Overview: This great apartment is located on Calle Mayor, just a few steps from Plaza Mayor and very near the famous Puerta del Sol and Mercado de San Miguel. It is great for discovering the city on foot. There are lots of tapas bars and typical Spanish wine taverns near the apartment. The recently refurbished Mercado de San Miguel is a great place for foodies, who will find hundreds of delicious things in this market. Nearby is Calle de Preciados - a lively street which is great for shopping. Madrid's most central square, the Puerta del Sol, is only two minutes' walk away from the apartment. It is very lively: a meeting point for Madrid residents and tourists alike.
Notes: Touristic licence: VT-1577
Transit: Sol metro station is just a couple of minutes away from the apartment. There you can take metro lines 1, 2 and 3. There are also several local trains that you can take from there.
Access: The reception desk is open daily from 9 am to 6 pm. For arrivals later than 6 pm an automated check-in system is available. Check-in is from 3 pm. Check-out is by 11 am.
Interaction: The reception desk is open daily from 9 am to 6 pm and our friendly staff are on hand to make recommendations and help you with anything you might need. Outside these times a member of staff is always on call for any emergencies and you will have their direct line.
Host About:
I live in Madrid, a city that has captivated me from the start for its culture, history and beauty. I work as a full-time host for Aspasios and couldn’t think of a better job: at Aspasios we love to make our guests feel at home. A big part of our job is listening carefully to our visitors: we learn so much from them every day. We enjoy meeting each and every person who comes to stay with us, and want them to come back because of us. We pride ourselves on being professional and friendly at the same time. At Aspasios, we are passionate about hospitality.

My colleague Luis and I are always on hand to help you make the most of your trip to Madrid. We know this lovely city inside out, so can recommend plenty of restaurants, bars and activities that you might not find in the guide books!

Vivo en Madrid, una ciudad que me ha cautivado desde el principio por su cultura, historia y belleza. Trabajo como manager para Aspasios y no podía pensar en un mejor trabajo: a Aspasios nos encanta que nuestros huéspedes se sientan como en casa. Una gran parte de nuestro trabajo es escuchar atentamente a nuestros visitantes: aprendemos mucho de ellos todos los días. Nos gusta conocer a todos y cada uno de los que vienen a quedarse con nosotros, y queremos ser la causa para que vuelvan. Nos enorgullecemos de ser amables y profesionales al mismo tiempo. En Aspasios, nos apasiona la hospitalidad.
Mis colegas y yo estamos siempre a tu disposición para ayudarte a sacar el máximo provecho de tu viaje a Madrid. Conocemos que esta ciudad de adentro hacia afuera, y podemos recomendar restaurantes, bares y actividades que no puedes encontrar en los libros de guía!

Name: Cozy, quiet & stunning 1Br apt - Centro: El Rastro
Summary: Newly listed in March after a full refurbishment. 2nd floor, cozy, quiet, stunning and clearwhite 1Br apartment in Madrid Centro (El Rastro), one of the most typical and central neighborhoods in Madrid. Wooden floors, exposed brick walls, high ceilings... in a nutshell, a beautiful apartment that will make you fall in love with Madrid even more. Least but not last... Don't forget to enjoy El Rastro that takes place on Sunday mornings... literally 50 steps away from your Home in Madrid! Enjoooy!
Space: Apartment located in El Rastro (in Calle Fray Ceferino González, 5), at the heart of the city, where a famous flea market takes place in Sunday mornings and bank holidays. Madrid center or El Centro, is one of the best places on earth to eat some "tapas", and going to La Latina neighborhood, which is 3mins away, is a no brainer. Plaza Mayor, the Royal Palace, Puerta del Sol, Opera, Preciados street, Gran Via is just at hand, it would make you think Madrid city center is really tiny! The flat has everything you can ask for: - One double bed  - Wifi. - A fully equipped kitchen with ceramic cooker, dishwasher, oven and microwave. - Bed linen, towels, shower gel and shampoo. Will love to be your host and try to give you some very personal tips. It will be my pleasure to make you feel at home. Enjoy Madrid! (...you sure will!)

Name: Stunning Penthouse apartment
Summary: Ático disponible a partir del 1 de marzo en el centro de Madrid. El apartamento dispone de un gran salón comedor de 60 metros cuadrados perfecto para eventos. Esta estancia conecta con una terraza  desde la que se puede observar una importante panorámica de la ciudad de Madrid, desde el centro histórico hasta la cuidad financiera. La casa está rodeada por jardines de antiguos conventos, lo cual hace de este lugar un espacio único por su tranquilidad y su ubicación. En el epicentro entre el barrio de Salamanca y el barrio de Chueca.
Space: El enclave donde se localiza hace de este apartamento un lugar único.  La sensación de estar en el centro de la ciudad pero en conexión con la naturaleza y la tranquilidad que aporta el silencio y las vistas de la ciudad por encima de los jardines hacen que el huésped sienta la sensación de vivir en una casa exenta. El jardín vertical de la terraza así como la plataforma del solárium hacen de la casa un espacio único para eventos y cenas familiares o con amigos. Si hablamos del diseño y la arquitectura del interior, el huésped podrá convivir con muebles y obras de arte antiguas y contemporáneas, que hacen de la vivienda un espacio único y con cierto eclecticismo. La distribución es idónea para dos parejas, o una familia con niños, dado que las dos habitaciones quedan completamente independientes, con su baño y su vestidor.  Ambas tienen vistas hacia la ciudad financiera de la ciudad y se pueden observar las estrellas desde cada una de las estancias. Toda la vivienda es exterior e inclu

Neighborhood Overview: El apartamento se encuentra en pleno barrio de Chamberi, en el límite entre el barrio de Chueca y el barrio de Salamanca. Chamberi es un barrio residencial tranquilo con buenas conexiones a las principales arterias comerciales y de ocio de la ciudad. Tanto caminando como en transporte público.
Transit: La vivienda está a 100 metros de la parada de metro de Alonso Martínez, donde confluyen las líneas de metro más importantes de la ciudad. Una de ellas, la línea 8 nos conecta directamente con el aeropuerto.

Pudiendo llegar a la plaza de chueca o la Gran Vía en 15 minutos caminando, centro neurálgico de restaurantes y zonas de fiesta. De esta misma forma y cruzando la Castellana, los huéspedes pueden llegar a la famosa calle Serrano, donde encontrarán la mejor oferta comercial de la zona.
Interaction: El trato con el huésped será el que el mismo necesite. Dandole el asesoramiento necesario para acudir a eventos, museos, teatros, e incluso facilitándole las reservas a los mismos. Notes: English: It is important to plan well arrival according to the type of transport used because being center of Madrid there are days that cut traffic or events are made so we recommend you to contact me as soon as possible to coordinate and not having transportation incidents . I usually ask the flight number or train to take control if arrival is delayed , I recommend the metro is the fastest , cheapest and safest route Español: Es importante planificar bien la llegada según el tipo de transporte que utilicen porque al ser centro de Madrid hay días que cortan el tráfico o que se hacen eventos por lo que recomendamos que se comuniquen conmigo cuanto antes para coordinar y no tener incidencias de transporte. Suelo pedir el numero de vuelo o tren para tener control de llegada por si se retrasa recomiendo el metro, es la via mas rápida, barata y segura.
Transit: A crowded square, surrounded by tall buildings, architecture, cinemas, restaurants and leisure places. A place exists in the heart of Madrid - the Plaza Callao, famed as much for its role as the heart of cinematic and theatrical. Visitors will find much to discover here.  Sitting on the confluence of the important shopping streets Calle del Carmen and Calle de Preciados, along with Calle Jacometrezo (and of course Gran Via).  In 2005, the entire Plaza Callao was pedestrianized, which allows for visitors to spend as much time as they like in unhurried admiration of the architecture
Access: This is an apartment in a historical building with a local neighborhood. The building is a quiet and secure place for living. It is a fourth floor flat with a sharing elevator and common areas (there is main entrance door for other apartments in the building)
Interaction: Live out owner. I receive all my guests in order to welcome them. Also give some indications about the place and area, hand the key and answer any doubt.  Apart of this I will be available 24 hours a day 7 days a week.
House Rules: Check-in is from 2pm, and check-out is by 12 am. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first. Being a family home, we also have a no smoking policy. What you do in your personal time is entirely up to you, but when staying at our place we have a strict no drug use policy. This is just the law… not so much one of our rules. To keep our costs down (and pass those savings on to our guests) we kindly ask that you switch off lights and the A/C or heating when it’s not in use or leaving the house. Mother Nature thanks you too To be considerate to the neighbors, we kindly ask to keep things on the quieter-side after 9pm. And if you want to listen to music, please remember the other neighbors and enjoy via headphones or in your personal space. We’ll make sure to reciprocate the favor. We understand that for a whole verity of reasons, you may want additional guests to stay in the place. In the event that you want additional guests
Host About:
Adoro tener visitas, así que pensé que tenerlas todo el año puede ser una buena idea, Compré este apartamento con este fin, poniendo cuidado al detalle y la comodidad, recién reformado y amueblado ofrece ese aire nuevo y cuidadoso de las cosas hechas con amor.
Quiero que mis huéspedes disfruten de Madrid, de su entorno, de su magia, su comida, su vida nocturna y cultural, su rastro, sus tapas, su Gran Via, su Bernanebu, Cibeles, Alcalá, sol, música y multiculturalidad.
En mi encontraran el apoyo que siempre solemos buscar al hacer un viaje, alguien que les pueda orientar, ayudar en todo momento.
Mi máxima es la excelencia, la calidad, busco no solo que sea un lugar para estar sino un hogar por unos días para cada uno, día a día cuido los detalles para hacerles sentir en 5*.
Madrid me acogió hace 16 años, gracias a esta ciudad debo mi vida laboral y personal, gracias a este Madrid tengo una historia que contar. Con orígenes en Colombia busco ese nexo entre culturas, esa apertura al mundo, ese darnos la mano entre hermanos de esta tierra que lo que busca solo es que la apreciemos y la disfrutemos. Pues bien, mientras estés aquí intentaré que sientas toda la energía y el cariño de alguien agradecido con esta tierra y ahora quiero darla a conocer 
Bienvenidos.
Street: Sol, Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid 28013, Spain

Name: Odonell Loft
Summary: Cozy and modern one bedroom apartment, very well located in the well known Salamanca district in the Fuente del Berro neighborhood a few steps away from the beautiful park with the same name.
Space: Located on the outskirts of the Salamanca District, and only 15 minutes away from the historic centre, this modern, cosy, recently renovated loft apartment offers a comfortable space, ideal for a trained professional or a couple seeking tranquillity. It is conveniently located near major streets such as Goya, Alcalá and the Manuel Becerra Square. The Fuente del Berro neighbourhood is a calm area, with one-story houses, and its location allows for easy connections with the rest of the city. Fuente del Berro is a neighbourhood known for the park of the same name, and the apartment lies just a few minutes away from the park, probably the least known among the historical gardens of Madrid. It is a quiet, hidden place of great beauty, situated on the land that was once the Quinta de Miraflores, commissioned by Philip IV as a new royal site, an oasis within the city. This apartment is on the ground floor, and it can be access directly by a quiet street. The apartment was designed to be a mod

It is a quiet, hidden place of great beauty, situated on the land that was once the Quinta de Miraflores, commiss
Neighborhood Overview: Fuente del Berro is one of the six neighbourhoods that make up the Salamanca District in Madrid. Here lies the Fuente del Berro residential area, with small detached and attached houses built in the early 19th century, with high purchasing prices. Also, on the eastern part of the neighbourhood lies the Quinta de la Fuente del Berro Park. It has a landscape garden with several levels, and it is made up by meadows scored with sinuous walks and rustic stone steps. It also has a rich variety of trees. Among the most noted elements to be found in the park are the monument to Bécquer, the statue dedicated to the poet Pushkin, fountains, waterfalls, a couple of small ponds, and a small palace, the only remnant of its regal past.
Notes: SECURITY DEPOSIT: on arrival, guests will be asked to pay a security deposit as a guarantee for damages with credit card, between 500€ and 800€ depending on the length of the stay.   This deposit will be refunded automatically between 2 and 7 days after the end of the stay, if the apartment is returned in good conditions. For monthly rentals is required a complete cleaning at the end of each month, included on the total rental price that is not negotiable.
House Rules: Conozca nuestra politica con respecto a los horarios de llegada y salida:  Se aplicará un recargo de 30 Euros en los siguientes casos: •Llegada tarde, posterior a las 21:00 horas.  •Llegada en festivos. La entrada a los apartamentos es a partir de las 15 horas del día de la llegada. La salida debe realizarse antes de las 11 horas del día de la salida. Se aplicará un recargo de 50 Euros en los siguientes casos: •Llegada muy tarde, posterior a las 23:00 horas. NORMAS DE LA CASA: Como cliente, debe respetar las normas de la casa y la comunidad a la que pertenece.  El apartamento no será usado como lugar para realizar fiestas o celebraciones de ningún tipo. Por favor, lea atentamente estas normas para evitar cualquier tipo de problemas. Nuestro objetivo principal es que tengan una excelente experiencia durante su visita a la ciudad. •Por favor respete a sus vecinos. Los vecinos son gente que se levanta temprano para ir a trabajar, por lo que le pedimos que modere el nivel sonoro tanto en l

It's near to a beautiful park Rio Madrid, great for a walk, biking or chillin'. If you are a football fan, stadium Vicente Calderon is very close. You can easily reach downtown by bus or metro.
Notes: Check in-out is flexible and depends on my work.
Transit: 10 min walk from metro Marques de Vadillo (green line, n5) or from Plaza Eliptica (grey line, n6). Parking is for free, on the same street and there is always a space. You have a bus number 116 departing from Embajadores and stops very close to my place. Also 2 direct buses from Atocha (E1 and 55). Keep in mind that it's on the other side of the Airport Barajas, so it takes an hour to get here from the airport.
Interaction: Sometimes i am here sometimes not, so you will have your space as much as you want. I know Madrid quite well and i can give you tips where to go and what to visit.
House Rules: I like to have my flat clean so it would be nice to leave it the same way. You don't have to rub and brush before you leave, just keep it clean. No parties here, Madrid is  a party city so you can find a good entertainment outside. Also a responsible use of light and water.  No smoking, yes singing and dancing if you wish so. You will get a key and please don't lose it, it will cost you 10eur (the price of the key).
Host About:
Happy human being
Have been living in Madrid last 10 years. I really like this city and I can recommend what, where and how to enjoy it.  I can do some body language if the rest doesn't work, with Spanish, English, Slovenian and some Portuguese would be easier.
Dance, music and books, i enjoy all that alone or in company.

At the main room you will find a queen size bed (160 × 200 meters), and the room is connected to a dressing room and a large bathroom.  The other room has two single beds, a small tv with DVD, and a small closet.  There is another bathroom with a spacious shower. At the kitchen you can find the soul of the house as it is perfect to plan the day while enjoying a drink and snacks thanks to its 3 meter long kitchen island, farther you will find an American style fridge, and compete set of things you might need to cook or eat at home.  At the dining room you will find a confortable sofa bed  (it becomes a 1.40 x 2.00 bed), two armchairs, a 42 inch TV, a bluetooth Speaker and a beautiful dining table. The house is decorated with care to make our guests feel at home.

Neighborhood Overview: Malasaña is the most interesting neigborhood in Madrid, where you can find trend setting stores (clothing, deco and art stores, coffee shops, restaurants,...), the largest street mall in Madrid (calle Fuencarral and Preciados), theaters, and nite life. All this together with its architecture makes it perfect to enjoy just walking around. Eventhough the neigbourhood is full of life the street where the house is located is very quiet. If you are looking to do some tourism you can find with in walking distance (in a radio of less than 30 minutes walking) the most important attractions such as Museums (El Prado, Reina Sofia or Thyssen), the old city centre (Madrid de los Austrias, Sol, Cibeles, or even El Retiro), and the modern Madrid (paseo de la castellana, Santiago Bernabeu,...).
Transit: From the apartment you can walk to almost most places in the city, but if you need to take public transportation you can find buses and metro stations which will take you anywhere within 5 minutes walk. To get to the apartment from the airport I would recommend to take a taxi (flat rate to city centre around 30 €), but you can also take the metro to either Tribunal Station or Noviciado.
Access: There is WiFi available and washing and drying machine.
Interaction: We like to keep our guest privacy and therfore we try to minimize contact, but we are always reachable and happy to help.

Neighborhood Overview: The two inner-city barrios of Malasaña and Chueca are where Madrid gets up close and personal. Here, it’s more an experience of life as it's lived by madrileños (people from Madrid) than the traditional traveller experience of ticking off from a list of wonderful, if more static, attractions. These are barrios with attitude and personality, barrios where Madrid's famed nightlife, shopping and eating choices live and breathe and take you under the skin of the city.
Notes: Our prices are based on. 1. Our location. The best of all Madrid, no doubt. In the heart of leisure and tourism, one of the streets and one of the most popular and trendy neighborhoods. 2. The quality, design and size of our rooms, since it is a recently renovated house, and the beds, pillows, bed linen, etc ... are new, with the best qualities 100% cotton and with the most current materials . 3. The quality and cleanliness of our bathrooms, with a modern design, goog size and the best materials. 4. Breakfast included
Access: The bathroom can be shared with another guest room or private depending on the occupation Dinning Room - Will be available only for use during breakfast. Breakfast included , consisting of, fresh juice, bio coffee or different kinds of tea with regular fresh milk, soya bio milk or almond bio milk. Bakery, yogourts and bio cereals. With some smooth and jazzy music. From 9am till 10.30am.
Interaction: Ask us about any type of recommendation, we can get you reservations in cool restaurants, flamenco live music places, VIP lists for a lot of clubs, fashion and vintage stores and of course typical tourist sites. We have private pick up service at the airport. Ask us!
House Rules: 1/ - Check in        We received from 2pm till 10pm. But you must notify us of your exact arrival time    -Check out till 12pm. 2/ Smoking in the rooms or in the rest of the house is not allowed.  3/ Please don't eat cooked/take away food, or food, chocolate, etc.. that can stain or smell inside the room. We have a dinner table for that.  4/ The room and the house access is for the person or two persons who book it, do not invite or come with others please.  5/ We don´t accept reservations for third persons, The person or persons who come home must be the same person who has made the reservation. In case you want to reserve for another person, you must consult us first. 6/ Energy Conservation. - The lights are not in use should be off.  - The radiators have an automatic program on and off, please not manipulate them. - Please keep in mind you are sharing the house with more people, late night showers and noise may impact other guests & owners rest times. Be considerate with your shower

Neighborhood Overview: It owes its name to the Supreme Court and to the Court of Auditors, courts historically placed in this neighbourhood.  Nowadays it houses the area of Chueca too, one of the most pleasant and fashionable areas of Madrid for shopping, having lunch or dinner, or having a drink.   ! In the neighbourhood we shall highlight the Plaza de la Villa de París, placed just opposite the building, and the Plaza de las Salesas.  ! It is just next to the Barrio de Salamanca and its famous Calle Serrano, where we can find a selection of the best shops in Madrid. It is only five minutes away walking from the best areas of Almagro and Barrio de Salamanca.   ! It is ideal to enjoy gastronomy and culture, being the nearest highlighted places the Centro Cultural Fernando Fernán Gómez or the ancient Carlos III cinema, reconverted to one of the most exclusive gastronomic markets of Madrid, the  ‘Platea’.
Notes: Our rates dont include VAT The apartment is rented fully and exclusively. Once the guest is at the house we will hand over the keys to him and will explain the functioning of the house.  We will give the guest a telephone number  to contact us in case there is an emergency (24 hours service).

Host About:
THE SIBARIST BRAND. Property & Homes
Somos una empresa que gestiona propiedades singulares con altos estándares de calidad. Nos apasiona la hospitalidad y nuestro reto es que te sientas incluso mejor que en casa.
Hemos puesto en ellas los 5 sentidos:
- Vista: espacios singulares decorados cuidadosamente por nuestro equipo de interioristas pensando en tu confort y disfrute, para que desde el primer momento entres y te enamores.
- Tacto: porque pensamos en tu bienestar, hemos elegido sábanas y toallas de la mejor calidad. Porque no es lo mismo dormir entre sábanas 100% de algodón o envolverse en una gran toalla de baño después de una ducha o baño relajante. 
- Olor: apreciamos los buenos aromas y olores que te ayudan a relajarte al tomar una ducha o un baño. Por ello verás que hemos escogido cuidadosamente los geles de ducha que te ofrecemos.
- Sabor: todas nuestras casas, independientemente del tamaño, disponen de cocinas equipadas y diseñadas para que los más disfrutones del arte culinario puedan deleitar a los suyos con sabrosos platos. También te recomendaremos nuestros restaurantes favoritos en los alrededores de cada casa, para que cuando salgas a comer o cenar no te equivoques.
- Oído: si de algo presumimos en nuestras casas es del silencio y del descanso que se respira en ellas. Por muy céntricas que se encuentren, en todas ellas disfrutarás de la tranquilidad que necesitas cuando te refugies del bullicio de la ciudad. 

*****
SIBARIST THE BRAND. Property & Homes 
We are a company that manages unique properties with high quality standards. We are passionate about hospitality and our challenge is to make you feel even better than at home. 
We have applied in the properties we manage “the 5 senses”: 
-Sight: We offer unique spaces decorated carefully by our interior design team thinking in your comfort and enjoyment so that from the first moment you enter you fall in love with the place. 
- Touch: Because we believe in your welfare, we have selected sheets and towels of the highest quality. Because it is not the same to sleep between sheets 100% cotton or get wrapped in a great bath towel after a shower or a relaxing bath. 
- Smell: We appreciate the good scents and smells that help you relax when taking a shower or bath. For that reason you will see we have carefully chosen the shower gels that we offer. 
- Taste: all our homes, regardless of size, have been equipped with unique designed kitchens in order for the most culinary fans to delight their families and friends with their own tasty dishes. We also recommend our favorite restaurants around every house, so that when you go out for lunch or dinner  you make no mistakes. 
- Ear: if we are proud, in our houses, for something, it is by the silence and repose that permeates them. However central they are, in all of them you will have the peace of mind you need when you take shelter from the bustle of the city.
Street: Justicia, Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid 28004, Spain

See you soon!

Marta estudió trabajo social y luego una FP de informática, ahora trabaja como técnico de informatica en el CSIC; Steph estudió "estudios de las mujeres" y es una profesora de Ingles; Alba estudió psicología y lleva aquí unos años estudiando varios masters. Neighborhood Overview: La Latina: With El Rastro flea market, the tapas, Las Vistillas Gardens and much more, this fun-loving area of Madrid is a must for to. Sitting right in the heart of Madrid, La Latina is bordered by other attractive areas which you can also take a look at: Madrid de los Austrias (Hapsburg Madrid), Sol-Gran Vía, Lavapiés and Madrid Río Park. The narrow and winding streets of this irregularly laid-out area, mostly dating back to the Middle Ages, usually lead onto a square. Basilica of San Francisco el Grande Built in the eighteenth century, this basilica boasts one of Europe’s largest domes, which, at 58 metres high and 33 metres in diameter, crowns the rotunda. Its museum houses an important collection of paintings from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. Museum of San Isidro The Museum of San Isidro provides an account of Madrid’s archaeological resources and the material, social and spiritual heritage of the various civilisations that have lived here. Neighborhood Overview: El barrio está especialmente animado los fines de semana. El Rastro, los domingos, es una de las atracciones turísticas más importantes de la ciudad. Los bares inundan toda la zona. En los alrededores: la Plaza Mayor, el barrio de las Letras, las compras en Preciados y Gran Vía, el Palacio Real, la catedral de la Almudena, los jardines de Las Vistillas o el puente de Segovia. Cruzando Gran Vía, a unos 20 minutos caminando, el "moderno" Malasaña y el ambiente gay en Chueca. 20 minutos también separan a La Latina de el Barrio de Las Letras, junto a la zona de los museos: El Prado y el Thyssen.
Notes: En el apartamento vivimos mi perrita, Sua y yo. Es muy importante que lo tengas en cuenta si eres alérgico/a a los perros o no te gustan los animales. El edificio es de reciente construcción y cuenta con ascensor.
Transit: Lavapiés está muy bien comunicado por estar en pleno centro de Madrid. Los metros más cercanos son Lavapiés y Tirso de Molina que conecta directamente con Atocha Renfe al aeropuerto y Atocha autobús aeropuerto. También caminando a Sol (7 min.) hay Cercanías y múltiples lineas de autobús para recorrer la ciudad.
Access: Como vivo en casa, cocina y baño están completamente equipados. En el baño hay gel, champú, pasta de dientes, colonia de baño, papel higiénico... También se ofrecen toallas limpias y secador de pelo. El salón es de uso común. Siéntete como en casa!

Neighborhood Overview: El Barrio de las Letras, donde dar un paseo es "caminar sobre arte literario" por las celebres citas literarias que se han grabado en muchas baldosas en la calle Huertas. Un lugar donde la historia y la literatura van de mano con el arte. El Barrio de las Letras se encuentra en pleno centro: con sus calles estrechas y su encanto representa una de las zonas mas atractivas de Madrid. Casas señoriales, conventos, bares y restaurantes actuales con sabor añejo: el arte se respira en las calles.
Transit: Posición optima. A diez minutos caminando: - Puerta del Sol, siguiendo hasta el Teatro Real y el Palacio Real. - La Latina, donde el mercado dominical El Rastro llena sus calles de colores y alegría. - Plaza Mayor - barrio de Lavapiés - grandes museos de la ciudad (Museo del Prado, Museo Reina Sofia, Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza) - Plaza de Cibeles, hasta llegar a la Puerta de Alcalá donde se abren las puertas del pulmón verde de Madrid, el Parque del Retiro. Estaciones de metro cercanas (Anton Martín/Atocha - linea 1, Sevilla/Sol - linea 3) y paradas de taxis.
Access: Independencia y autonomía para los huéspedes, bajo cada punto de vista. Mi apartamento se encuentra en el mismo piso, justo la puerta de enfrente por lo tanto, estaré disponible para cualquier necesidad.
Interaction: Disponibilidad para cualquier necesidad: información y consejos para encontrar sitios buenos y conocidos donde comer, salir de fiesta o simplemente dar un paseo agradable para conocer bien los rincones escondidos de Madrid.
House Rules: Siéntete en casa y haz que los que vengan después de ti se sientan con tu. Cuna disponible para toda la estancia con suplemento fijo de 20€. Opción plaza de garaje con suplemento.

Name: Facing Reina Sofía's Museum.WIFI
Summary: Great location for visit Madrid, right on Reina Sofia Museum's plaza. You can visit, just walking, the Prado museum, the Thyssen-Bornemisza museum, Retiro park,  Botanical Garden, Caixa Forum... It has a spacious and luminous living room with comfortable sofas, a 49 '' LED smart TV, and WIFI (provided by 50MB fiber optic). Ideal for 4 people but can sleep up to 7 people. Next to bars, restaurants, terraces, Metro, train station, bus lines... It has an elevator.
Space: APARTMENT SERVICES - WIFI and access to the router (for cable or powering off) - Security door - A clean set of sheets and towels for each person staying (provide and acurate number, please) and an additional one for longer stays. - Iron and ironing board -  A.C. unit in the living room - There will be complimentary mineral water, fruit and snacks for guests upon arrival BUILDING - The elevator has recently been refurbished, as well as the portal. - It has hot water (natural gas) and adjustable heating. THE BEDROOMS - Room 1: A newly accquired double bed ( 150x190cm with an encapsulated  springs and viscoelastic mattress), bedside tables on either side, dresser and wardrobes. - Room 2: With smaller dimensions, has 2 single beds, also new, of 80x190cm and a generously sized closet. THE KITCHEN - It has everything you need to prepare meals and breakfasts. Oven, refrigerator, microwave, juicer, toaster, Nespresso... - It also has a washer/ dryer and dishwasher. LIVING ROOM - It has 2 sofa

THE BEDROOMS - Room 1: A
Neighborhood Overview: - For it's location in the same plaza, it has a lot of life and animation. You have right there numerous bars and terraces for tapas and drinks.  - You can visit right on foot (in addition to the Reina Sofia museum), the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, the Prado Museum, the Royal Botanic Garden of Madrid, the Retiro Park, , the Cuesta Moyano (market secondhand book), the Lavapies neighborhood, the Letters neighborhood There are lots and lots of restaurants near by. - It is very, very well connected, next to the Atocha subway station (Line 1) and Atocha station railroad (the most important of the city) and numerous bus stops for diferent lines. There is an endless supply of Taxis right there on Carlos V plaza.
Transit: The best way to know the neighborhood is walking. Everything is close by. - You can reach Sol with a 15/20 minutes walk, or 14 minutes by subway or 12 minutes by commuter train. - If you prefer the metro (Atocha), it is just 200 meters away. In addition, across the square, it is the Atocha railway station. - Right in the same square, there are parking places from Bicimad. - There are many bus lines running through the axis of Paseo del Prado, lines (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) and numerous "night" buses. Also they pass through Atocha the street Lines 6, 26, 32 - There is a steady stream of taxis in Paseo del Prado
Interaction: -  I am available on the mobile, the airbnb chat and email to answer any questions, I will try to help you in whatever you may need -  I do not tend to interact with guests. I like to make it a very independent visit for you
House Rules: -  It's a residential building, so please be respectful towards the neighbours (and the house) and KEEP NOISE TO A MINIMUM after 23:00 THIS IS AN ESSENTIAL RULE -  No loud music, please -  Parties and pets are not allowed -  Smoking inside the apartment is not allowed. It's ok in the balconies -  Don't loose the keys. It would mean a 50€ charge - There is no cleaning fee under the condition of leaving the apartment in similar state as it was when the guest entered the house. If it's necessary to hire a cleaning service (for the bad conditions of the apartment), the guest would need to pay the fee (50€) before departure. - Please, state clearly who will be coming (number of guests) at the apartment. Access to third parties (not declared) will not be permited. It would mean the automatic cancellation. -  Please let me know if anything gets damaged or broken during your stay

Name: Bohemian 2bedroom attic in Lavapies
Summary: Peaceful apartment in Madrid multicultural city centre. Plenty of window ceilings, exposed wood beams, stone and relaxed furniture. Conveniently located, right in the heart of funky and increasingly trendy neighborhood Lavapies. Walk distant to a 3 different subway stations.
Space: 46 square meters - 495 sq ft. Very tranquil, half of the apartment faces to the quiet courtyard of the block and the other half faces to the street, no matter how all the light comes through window ceilings. Shining, bright. Each single room has its own window ceiling, the living room has two, as well as the bathroom and kitchen. Optimal for 2 couples (4 max.). Spacious bedrooms with queen size beds, and a bright living room with a confortable sofa, a ceiling-lamp and a crystal desk. Kitchen is fully equipped and is directly connected to the living room. Black-stoned floors in the living room, kitchen and bathroom areas and white-wooden floors on both bedrooms. Walls are soft-grey color and there's a soft-grey sliding door in every bedroom and bathroom. The building was built in the year of 1900 and it has a open-sky courtyard, a typical corrala which retains the taste of yesteryear. The whole building has been recently refurbished so you shouldn't worry too much about the temperature

Space: When I say that the room and the house, are the heart of Madrid , it is real. Neighborhood Overview: Madrid city centre is full of life and save-La Latina is one of the oldest neighborhoods in the centre of the city of Madrid. Our  patron, San Isidro, lived here and you can find lots of stories, history and legend about he and his time. So with 7th Century, when madrid was called Magerit. The area is full of sites and museums that refer to this fact. The Collegiate Church (Old Cathedral of Madrid) and the Museum of San Isidro. You have too a very big area for tapas, drink, dance and listen to very good music of different styles. La Latina is a wonderful and very good area for bars, tapas, restaurants, concerts, theater ... I'm sure you know, so you have chosen to stay here. There are a wide range from Plaza de Puerta Cerrada to Puerta de Toledo and through the Plaza de la Cebada. Going through all styles and tastes when it comes to tapas, the more abundant is the typical from Madrid, with vermouth de grifo, wonderful tapas, good beer and good wine. Also, you have historical restaurant
Notes: In the kitchen you can cook , while meals are not very fragrant and everything is picked to finish . In the fridge you have space for leave some food.
Transit: The apartment is next to the metro station of La Latina (line 5 subway , light green ) , near the metro station of Tirso de Molina (line 1 subway , light blue color) and Sol ( lines 1,2 and 3 subway , RENFE directly connected with Adolfo Suarez-Barajas Airport ) There are also many bus lines and a taxi rank next to the La Latina metro . On the street where I live, you can park a moto or a car.
Access: Once in the apartment , you have access to the bathroom, the living room, to the balconies and kitchen. The living room has ceiling fans to cool the atmosphere and there is a small fan in the room . The house has a very good distribution for light, air renewal , as the distribution of heat in winter. Also humidifier in the house .
Interaction: For any incident , you can always count on me. Both, inside and outside the house . I'm from Madrid,yes, you've found a 100 madrilian girl% !, and I know the city very well .
House Rules: If you are a smoker , there are two balconies in the living room with seating and able to smoke at home . The only thing you can not do is upload home to people outside the reservation , neither room or in the common areas .
Host About:
¡Hola! ¡Me encanta conocer a personas educadas y respetuosas de otras partes! Madrid, que es mi ciudad, puede llegar a hacerte/os sentir que estáis como en casa. Soy madrileña 100% y adoro mi lugar de nacimiento en el que he crecido y vivo.

Hablo inglés perfectamente, trabajo en el ámbito cultural y social y me gustan las actividades relacionadas con lo cultural: la literatura, el teatro, la danza, el cine, la música, las exposiciones, viajes, la participación ciudadana, lo establecido, lo alternativo, etc.

Vivo en el centro de Madrid, el verdadero corazón histórico en el denominado "casco antiguo". Esta es una ciudad maravillosa llena de gente interesante, una gastronomía deliciosa, buen ambiente, "marcha" y mucho por vivir.

¡Te/Os espero!


Hi! I love to meet polite and respectful people from other places! Madrid, my city of birth and where I grew up, could be like a home for you. I´m a 100% madrilian girl and I love it. 

I work in cultural and social fields and I like very much everything related on culture: literature, theatre, music, dance, expositions, travels, citizen participation, etc.

I live in Madrid city centre, the real and historical heart of the town. It´s  full of interesting people,  delicious food and drink, great environment, "marcha" and lots of things to do and to live.

Let´s come to visit!

La Latina es uno de los barrios míticos de Madrid. Se caracteriza por su ambiente bohemio, artístico y su amplia variedad de restaurantes de tapas, de pinchos y bares de copas. Hay muy buen ambiente y es un barrio seguro. El apa
Access: El apartamento tiene un dormitorio con cama grande (1,40m) para 2 personas, una cama supletoria individual y un sofá en el salón para una persona.

Hola, soy Marina Skell, actriz argentina residente en Madrid desde 2001.
Con Karlos, mi marido desde hace 31 años, llevamos una Sala de Teatro en Madrid a la que podrás asistir durante tu estancia.
Me encanta viajar y soy usuaria de Airbnb!! me parece una manera muy cómoda de buscar alojamiento más personalizado que un hotel!
Me gusta cocinar, la fotografía, el cine, el teatro, leer. 
Me encanta vivir en Madrid, es mi lugar en el mundo!!!!
Hablo un poco de inglés, francés e italiano. Y español claro!!! Asi que podremos entendernos!!

Neighborhood Overview: It is a multicultural place, where the classic image, typical of the center of Madrid, meets the new trends of leisure and restaurants Theaters, exhibition halls and art galleries coexist with the many tapas bars and restaurants, which show us the day and night life, making us feel in a different neighborhood.
Transit: The apartment is very well connected. Just 10-15 minutes walk from the Atocha station. 2 minutes walk from Lavapies metro station and 4 minutes to Embajadores station. You can walk to the main tourist areas, about 15 minutes to Puerta del Sol, and 5 minutes to Gran Vía. Also to the Prado Museum, Reina Sofía Museum, Cibeles, Retiro Park, etc ... Next to the famous Rastro de Madrid. If you come by car, there is a public parking just below the apartment that rents places for days, has web. You also have a large supermarket in Lavapiés square within 2 minutes walk which is open 24 hours.
Access: Equipped with air conditioning and heating. Neighborhood Overview: Description of the Zone: Chamartin The Chamartin district is a charming area that combines an spirit and modern residential buildings and Chalets surrounded by gardens and quiet streets perfect for strolling, with many shopping and business areas where you can find all kinds of stores, supermarkets and one of the best markets in Madrid, the Potosi, for its  variety in all kinds of high quality food. Likewise there is a wide variety of restaurants of all types and categories, catering for Spanish and international cuisine. With typical Tapas bars and pubs, cafes, etc open late into the night accompany them as a complement to the activities of leisure, Pubs and Clubs of live music and so on. Through the Metro stations in Colombia and Cuzco, the area is communicated directly with the airport and the site of the International Fair of Madrid IFEMA at least 4 stations, as well as the Chamartin train station and the famous Santiago Bernabeu Stadium, the home of Real Madrid's football club. Name: CASA ARCO CUCHILLEROS-BOTIN
Summary: Ref# VT519  From the Tourist Companies Register of the Madrid Community - Tourism General Direction.
Space: CASA ARCO CUCHILLEROS-BOTIN    Situated in one of the most emblematic streets in Madrid, Cuchilleros Street and close to the Arco Cuchilleros from the most famous Plaza in Madrid, La Plaza Mayor, this apartment offers you a truly authentic "madrileño experience", with its great location. Cuchilleros Street is located below the Plaza Mayor. It is a street where you can find bars and restaurants nestled in real caves, which provide a unique and evocative atmosphere, that accompanied by a traditional very good gastronomy, get transport you to another world, another time. The entrance gate to the building is in Toledo Street number 16, close to the famous Toledo Arch from the Plaza Mayor, but the two balconies of the house are overlooking the Street Cuchilleros. Just below the two balconies it is the Madrid's oldest hairdresser-barbershop (since 1900), which retains the charm of those times, keeping objects as shaving basins (such the one that Don Quixote was used as a helmet). Neighborhood Overview: NEIGHBOURHOOD & LOCATION: Here in the heart of Madrid’s city centre you are surrounded by a taste of grocery stores,  tapas bars, like the great famous Mercado de San Miguel and lots of conveniences. This is the "Los Austrias Neighbourhood" Sol district, bordering with La Latina Neighbourhood with the Cava Baja Street or  Las Letras neighbourhood with Huertas Street and Plaza de Santa Ana. You are under less 1 minute to the Plaza Mayor and 5 minutes walk you arrive at Palacio Real, Opera or to the Km 0 at Puerta del Sol; the centre of Madrid and, in fact, the centre of Spain. The apartment is also very close to the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia museums, and the Botanic Gardens, Retiro Park, Gran Via, Cibeles Square and the Almudena Cathedral, as well as many theatres, cinemas, restaurants, tapas bars and only 5 minutes to El Rastro, the the very famous market situed in the streets during sundays mornings.  Nearby Metro station: Sol (L1, L2, L3) or La Latina (L5)

PM. -Surcharge of 20€ for unannounced and unjustified delay in appointment time. We give you an appointment time that must be met or give notice of your change with enough time. We always have many arrivals from several of ours apartments and we can not wait for hours if you decide to change your plans and go eat or to do shoping while we are waiting for you. Neighborhood Overview: We are in Nueva Numancia, Line 1, that connects you with the most important places to visit in the city and of course to the museums and the city center just a few stops from Nueva Numancia. 4 stops to Atocha train Station giving access to connections to other Spanish cities & to Parque del Retiro and Museums El Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia. From there you can also walk (or take the subway again since is the same line ) to Puerta del Sol, main square where we celebrate New Years Eve and where you will also find the statue Oso y el Madroño (symbol of the city).  5 Stops from your future guest house you will find Tirso de Molina, ideal if you want to visit the most famous street market in Madrid, El Rastro, full of antiques, clothes and street food. Nearby, for having a drink at night La Latina sounds like the perfect place, an inexpensive area where you can enjoy some of the best bars and restaurants. A few stops with the same line 1 you will find the Gran Via, main street in Madrid w
Notes: Sólo dispongo de una habitación para alquilar así que seréis los únicos huépedes en casa, además la habitación es bastante privada ya que no colinda con ninguna otra habitación. Tampoco tenemos vecinos arriba ya que es una casa en planta primera, así que no habrán ruidos molestos.
Transit: Subway just 5 minutes walking from home, different busses nearby too. Only 4 stops to Atocha, main museums and our central park Parque del Retiro.
Access: You can use the bathroom, shower gel and shampoo, as well as toilet paper is included. In the Kitchen you just can take water from the tap and use the fridge for your drinks. The rest of the kitchen is not for share.
Interaction: At arrival, we will provide you with a map of the center and directions to the main points to visit in the city as well as any information you may need. Arrival time is set to 12 midday however, it is possible sometimes to check in even during the night, if that's the case, please ask before booking. The Check out is at 11 am but you can leave your luggage at home and pick up it later. Sometimes you can even stay longer if there is not another booking for the day. During your stay, you can come in & out at any time night and day. I will provide you with a key.
House Rules: Just common sense rules like respecting others or not being noisy after 10pm and keeping clean the place, not bringing anyone from outside. You can use the kitchen to take water from the tap or to use the fridge only. Reglas de sentido común como mantener la casa limpia o no hacer ruido excesivo o no traer a nadie de fuera. De la cocina se puede usar solamente la nevera.

Name: Bright Double Room, Heart of Chueca
Summary: Welcome to the heart of Madrid!! Welcome to Spain!! We are located in Chueca, one of Madrid’s liveliest neighborhoods. We’re close to everything- museums, bars, restaurants, shops! You name it! We have 3 local Metro stations. And airport transfers are a breeze with your choice of train, metro, or bus just 5-10 minutes from here that go right to Barajas International. Your private room is a bright and quirky space with a double loft bed.  You’ll be able to relax in your room, or in our huge airy living rooms, or on one of our 2 lovely French balconies. Pick a spot and kick back! In the kitchen you’ll find everything you need to enjoy a nice meal. For fresh fruit, veggies, fish, etc. you have a few wonderful choices a few streets away: organic grocery, green market, 2 supermarkets. As for us, we are a happy-go-lucky, international bunch. Falkwyn, raised in Bali, and Francheska, raised in Manhattan, are excited to have you as our guests!  We have plenty of suggestions for activities aroun

We are a British and American couple living and loving life in Madrid.

Francheska is a dancing machine with a penchant for language.
Ben is a freelance photographer who loves running and cycling.

Together we share a love for the outdoors, exploring new places and eating great food. 

We really enjoy hosting here in Madrid and enjoy showing our guests a different side to the city. 

We speak a mishmash of English and Spanish at home, but we also speak Italian, and a little bit of French.

Neighborhood Overview: This is a very quiet area. There are bars on the street but they close quite early. There are supermarkets 5 minutes away and a park 2 minutes away. The area is safe and quiet at night.
Notes: The area is well connected to the city centre. The metro is a 10 min walk away and 15 mins on the metro brings into the city centre.There are also good bus connections even closer than the metro station.
Transit: The metro station (La Elipa, line 2, red) is 10 min walk awayand the red line brings you directly to some of Madrid's most important areas - Ventas, Retiro Park, Barrio de las Letras and Puerta del Sol. The Madrid Metro system is an excellent transport service and is very cheap compared to most European capitals. You can also use the buses. There is a bus stop in the street adjacent that has three buses taking you to Mendez Alvaro & Cuidad Lineal (113) and Manuel Becerra (110 & 210)

Name: Cute ibiza retiro room quiet!
Summary: Our apartment looks over the boulevard of Ibiza 1.5 blocks from the cool Retiro Park! Bus.metro and taxi so close you will love it. We offer breakfast if you like it. Balcony and full shower in your own bathroom.
Space: We offer a light bright room with two single beds (which can be pushed together if you like) and a full closet. Your private bath has a nice little shower. Ceilings are high, lights are strong and the wifi is good and fast enough!  The window looks out to the balcony. The location in Madrid is great for tourists! 1.5 blocks from the big Retiro Park and just outside the door many restaurants, outdoor cafes and fruits and pastry shops. We have excellent transportation ( bus, metro and millions of taxis!). At home, we enjoy a glass of wine or tea with our guests to get to know who is visiting us!  We hope you enjoy your time here and love Madrid as we do~
Description: Our apartment looks over the boulevard of Ibiza 1.5 blocks from the cool Retiro Park! Bus.metro and taxi so close you will love it. We offer breakfast if you like it. Balcony and full shower in your own bathroom. We offer a light bright room with two single beds (which can be pushed together if you like) and a full closet. Your private bath has a nice little shower. Ceilings are high, lights are strong and the wifi is good and fast enough!  The window looks out to the balcony. The location in Madrid is great for tourists! 1.5 blocks from the big Retiro Park and just outside the door many restaurants, outdoor cafes and fruits and pastry shops. We have excellent transportation ( bus, metro and millions of taxis!). At home, we enjoy a glass of wine or tea with our guests to get to know who is visiting us!  We hope you enjoy your time here and love Madrid as we do~ You can cook. Use the fridge. Use the livingroom.. enjoy the .Balcony and wash clothes...iron ....watch TV...come and go....wi
Neighborhood Overview: Everyone loves the park!!  The Prado is just on the other side of the park, too. Cafes and tapas are right outside the door or the city is at your feet via metro bus or taxi and others love to walk! Salamanca shopping is a quick bus ride or uphill crisp walk away. Serrano is also for the heavy shoppers by bus. BETTER are the MUSEUMS - all walkable or by bus. Reina Sofia, Thyssen are fabulous modern art museums. The Archeological museum, HARD ROCK CAFE up at Plaza COLON is a museum too...fun old time stuff.  The smaller intimate art museums we love. Museum SORIA and Lope de VEGA look them up! Wonderful houses of great authors/artists. ALSO  don't forget TOLEDO! It is a short train ride away, just 1/2 hour and about 13.50 RT euros.
Notes: Let us know what type of breakfast you like. BIG SMALL OR NONE.... PLEASE let us know YOUR TIME OF ARRIVAL by email as soon as you know it.   We want to be here when you arrive and if not, tell you how we arrange for you to get the keys ( usually at a neighboring restaurant 2 doors away, famous place!) DIRECTIONS to the apartment: from the airport ( see below for from the TRAIN STATION ATOCHA)   By taxi   fixed rate is E30. Directly to the address, in decent traffic, about 30 minutes. By Metro take  line 8 to COLOMBIA and change  to line #9 purple and off at IBIZA.  E 1.50 Colombia station is very nice, just an easy walk up one escalator, direction Aranda del Rey south. Though best with small luggage.  WHEN you EXIT the Metro it is a very easy walk straight ahead 1.5 blocks. Our building is on the left 2 doors after small SABADEL bank. Just buzz and we will let you in. by Airport Bus   E6 or E7.  best stop is O'DONNELL. you can walk down Calle Doctor Esquerdo - a long block (past the B
Transit: The usual:  Bus, metro taxi trains or foot. Bus 2, 15 takes you NEAR Puerto Sol, where you can walk to Plaza Mayor and the Palacio Nacional and the gardens. Mercado San Miguel everyone loves which is all walkable!  But for seniors there are taxis EVERYWHERE and they are cheap or reasonable! METRO is very easy to Puerto del Sol, simply change one stop away at Principe de Vergara to line #2 RED, cuatro Caminos to get off at Vodafone SOL.
Access: You can cook. Use the fridge. Use the livingroom.. enjoy the .Balcony and wash clothes...iron ....watch TV...come and go....with breakfast or not with our company or be free and independent. Ask for printing out your boarding passes or train tickets or anything else under 10 pages! Sleep as long as you like or be out to run around town at the first sign of light!
Interaction: We do live here too. Depends on what you want ....we have eaten with guests and other times not....sometimes we share a glass of wine or a cup of tea....sometimes not. All good.  I enjoy helping people do the usual tourist things in town. ASK for any help you need. There is literature in the bedroom for you. Maps, guides, taxi info, etc. Mostly we like to hear your stories, background, interests and dreams openly. AND IF YOU WANT YOUR PRIVACY WE LOVE OURS ALSO.  Just depends.
House Rules: If you cook please clean up after yourself, if you smoke, Only on the balcony! Common sense decency, like your grandmother would approve of...as an example! If you like your music....loud, headphones or please close your door. Ask for what you need, want and we will do the same. Small dogs are ok for short stays only.  Thanks!
Host About:
We moved to Spain from Los Angeles last March (2015). I am teaching English (esl)  in Madrid businesses. Doug, my husband is a retired aerospace scientist. 

We have enjoyed entertaining the last 10 years in L. A.  and  travelling around the U. S.
 Here, though we miss our community of friends from California, we love Spain and travelling around this amazing country and some of Europe too.

Now - in Madrid Spain,such a BEAUTIFUL CITY !!..... we look forward to sharing our space and meeting you, from around the world.   We can certainly help you with the basics OF MADRID TOURISM if you need any help, as there is so much to do and see in this great city....
we have already travelled around Spain a good deal ... so let´s share stories. OR If you need privacy, quiet and only space to go about your business that is fine fine fine  TOO !!
We are so close to the best in the city! We love the feeling of walking down the boulevards to sit at one of the many cafes, sipping wine with a tapa. It is just so delightfully Spanish - what can I say, OLE!





In our patio we have hosted  chamber music  birthday & dinner parties, Shakespeare play readings, and Mid-Summer night Dream parties for 5 years now... We love our outside dining room under the big trees.   Every holiday it seems we host events and often for various causes too.  If we present something ya'll are certainly invited.
Street: Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid 28009, Spain

Host About:
I am a friendly, personable and down-to earth woman who loves meeting new people and learning about new cultures. Originally form London, I decided to move to Madrid two years ago to immerse myself in another culture.
I currently work as an English teacher and am also a student myself learning the Spanish Language. I have lived in madrid for 2 years and have used the city to make great new friends and as a platform to discover other wonderful parts of Spain and so far my favorites have been Seville, Segovia, Salamanca, Bilbao and San Sebastian. I have not been overly crazy about Marbella. I am yet to discover all the other amazing parts of Spain.
My main interests are reading, music, sports and eating and sharing ideas with old and new friends. 
I feel that I as a guest in your house I would be as respectful, tidy and pleasant as I would be in my own home.
I would love to be able to explore other cities and have a nice comfortable place to stay at the same time that feels more like a home than a hotel does.
