Neighborhood Overview: Nearly everything you have two see and enjoy in Madrid downtown is whitin a very short walking distance, Plaza Mayor, Sol, Opera, The Royal Palace, the shopping walking street of Preciados, the emblematic Gran Vía, the lovely San Miguel Market, and the Cava Alta and Cava Baja Streets which are full of life and you can try the delicious "spanish tapas". On Sundays you can get to the colourful fleamarket of El Rastro, where you can find antiques, clothing and curiosities.
Notes: The street where the apartment is located is quiet and calm during the night if you prefer to rest, but also if you want to party, there is a lot of nightlife and gastronomic offers around the area.
Transit: The apartment has a superb communication, with 2 Metro stations within a walking distance, Tirso de Molina (Line number 1), and La Latina (Line number 5).  Train station of Sol is around de corner. Getting in train from the airport to Sol station takes half an hour and there is a train every 30 minutes from 6 AM to 23:30.  There are plenty of buses in the zone.
Access: The apartment is in a first floor with elevator,  it has 2 private bedrooms, (a double bedroom and a twin bedroom, and you can add if required one extra bed in the living room for a kid.) Beautiful and spacious living room, modern kitchen and a spacious bathroom with shower.  All the facilities are provided, heating, air conditioning, towels, blankets, TV, music stereo, microwave, washing machine, and kitchen utensils, WI-FI, and even a Coffee Machine. The apartment has 4 balconies with great views of the historic city.
Interaction: Hosts of the apartment, brothers Ernesto and Antonio, always welcome personally our guests. They inform them of everything they need to now about, and give their cellular phone to answer any questions customer could have.  They will provide you with everything you need for you to feel like home and have a great stay at Madrid.
House Rules: El inquilino deberá depositar una fianza de 200 €. No se permiten mascotas. No se permite fumar en el interior de la vivienda.  No se permiten fiestas para no molestar a los vecinos del edificio. La hora de entrada son las 14:00 y la hora de salida las 11:00. De nuestros huéspedes esperamos que disfruten al 100% de la estancia en el centro de Madrid.
Host About: I'm from Madrid and I love the alternative, cultural and night life which this city offers. Although almost everybody knows where Madrid is located, I think it is a city which continues surprising its visitors.

Name: Apartment in the heart of Madrid
Space: Apartment completely renovated and decorated by an interior decorator in an old building in the historic center of Madrid, in central but quiet street. The atmosphere is very nice. To visit the main tourist sites do not need to use public transport. A few minutes walk will get to places like the Plaza Mayor, the Opera House, the Puerta del Sol, the Royal Theatre ... And a little further, a 15 minute walk, the Puerta de Alcala, Plaza de Cibeles, the Thyssen Museum, the Museo del Prado ... Host About:
Hola soy Eduardo!

Soy una persona aventurera y es lo que me ha llevado a vivir en distintos países, conocer culturas y viajar mucho.

Vivo en en Madrid pero estoy prácticamente todo el tiempo fuera por viajes, así que he decidido compartir este increíble apartamento con todos. Pero no os preocupéis, estaréis muy bien atendidos por gran equipo de anfitriones me ayudan a cuidar a mis huéspedes cuando no estoy en la ciudad.

Me encanta viajar y todo tipo de viajes, de ocio y descanso, de turismo, de aventura, a grandes ciudades, pequeños pueblos o lugares salvajes, con familia, amigos o incluso solo. Disfruto mucho conociendo gente y aprendiendo de sus culturas.

He utilizado Airbnb para viajar en numerosas ocasiones y ahora me he decidido a ser anfitrión. Me gusta ofrecer un buen servicio, que la gente quede encantada de la experiencia y que disfruten en la vivienda, del barrio y de la ciudad en la que he vivido gran parte de mi vida y de la que estaré encantado de compartir sus mejores secretos.

Os invito a disfrutar de la estancia!

*******


Hi I'm Eduardo!

I travel a lot - for work and - the best part - also for pleasure. I love meeting new people, tasting new food, experiencing new cultures. I have lived in different countries and continents so traveling is very much part of my DNA as well as my life experience. I have used Airbnb in the past and I am now happy to host fellow travelers.

I live in Madrid but I spend most of my time traveling so I have decided to share my beautiful apartment with you.

This area includes the open plan kitchen, which is fully equipped with anything you need to cook and eat, including the stove, microwave,  and refrigerato
Neighborhood Overview: Cortes is also known as the "Barrio de las Letras," or literary Madrid. This is where Spain's most celebrated Golden Age authors - Miguel de Cervantes, Lope de Vega, Calderón de la Barca, Tirso de Molina - lived in the 17th century. This is the best and nicest neighbourhood in central Madrid; you’ll immediately note how elegant it is from an architectural standpoint. The core of the “barrio” is Plaza de Santa Ana, and the streets radiating off this plaza are packed with bars -- good for tapas and experiencing the local life! On the first Saturday of the month, the “Frog Market” (Mercado de la Rana—named for the singing frogs that were in the area hundreds of years ago) takes place in the streets of Cortes; area retailers participate in this monthly market selling vintage clothes, furniture, and more. The neighbourhood is very lively, however the street where this apartment is located is semi-pedestrian: only residents and taxis are allowed to drive on this street. Therefore, it’s a qui

A pick up from your arrival point (train station/airport/bus station) with the taxi driver we normally work with. Transit: The location of the apartment is perfect; you can visit everything in Madrid by foot or on our good public transport system. The main Madrid sites are well within a 15 minute walk and many are much closer: the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Bornemisza museums (5 minutes); the Retiro Park (8 minutes); the Gran Via and its neoclassic architecture (8 minutes); the Rastro market and La Latina neighbourhood, etc.  Antón Martín and Atocha, the nearest metro stops, are just 5-3 minutes away, respectively, so it’s easy to get around by metro if you wish. The apartment is also walking distance to Atocha, which is your arrival point if you get into town by train or with the shuttle train/bus from the airport.

Underneath the bed structure there is a big closet.    * A spacious bathroom with a nice and comfortable shower and lots of natural light.   * Wi-Fi is also available during your stay, how not ;) Also, there are individual aircon units for the summer and heating for the winter. Host About:
Hi!!

We welcome you to Spain and we wish you a good stay in Madrid!

Oscar works as a photographer and Vanessa is an actress and theatre producer. However, until some years ago Oscar was an engineer and Vanessa was a M&A lawyer. And then one day we decided to turn our lifes up side down and follow our real passions.

We are best friends and on May 2012 we decided to move forward and enroll in a small business together. Vanessa had been hosting with Airbnb for 2 years by then (renting the spare room at her place in Madrid/Milan and her apartment in Barcelona) and her experience (upgraded to Superhost in early 2011) was so positive that we decided we could also help other owners that don't live in town or don't have the time to rent their properties to travelers as you. And this is what we are doing now together. 

More about us, we love to travel: Vanessa has travelled 4 out of the 5 continents with a backpack that has been with her for 18 years now and now has enrolled in her new adventure: becoming a mum in spring 2017. Conversely, Oscar travels by bike and closer to Madrid, so as often as he can he takes his bike for a short trip in the mountains (he's really fit!). He has also spent several summers working in France. As the business grew, we took more people on board. Firstly Paula, a Venezuelan that has been living in Madrid for 10 years now, also keen on travels and on exploring new places. Paula is full of energy and we love her smiley caracter. And last but not least, Nuria, whom you'll see on weekends and public holidays (and more often when the baby will be born and Vanessa will disappear for a while).

We are also keen in meeting new people and learning new things from them, but more importantly, we want you to feel at home at any of our apartments and that you feel that there's someone in town who cares for you:-) 

We enjoy little life pleasures like riding our bicycles or growing our small organic vegetables gardens. We like eco-friendly environments since we care a lot about our planet. 


We will help you to find you like home in this beautiful city and we look forward to having the opportunity to meet you soon!!

Vanessa_Oscar_Paula (& Nuria)
